One Identity System Architect (REF1490N)
The Access4You Service Hub bundles the identity, authentication and authorization portfolio for Deutsche Telekom globally. To enable access to all necessary IT services, our portfolio also includes IT Shop for our employees at Deutsche Telekom and virtual desktop services for external partners. Our customers are all corporate segments and international entities, followed by the applications that require identity and access management services in a secure and compliant way. Core Technologies used in our ecosystem are One Identity, MS Active Directory and Azure AD, IBM ISAM/ISVA, syscovery SavvySuite, Intercede & Nexus Group PKI to deliver our products and services around CIAM/CAIMAN, Corporate Active Directory, Telekom SSO, MyIT and VDS. The hub is structured into SAFe driven value streams (DevOps) and operations focused value streams.
You work together with:
managers of the hub and partner hubs ‚Äì consulting, alignment of strategy
architects from workplace related areas like the Client Hub or Collaboration Hub
our product management, customers and suppliers to help ensure fitness for purpose
our product owners and teams within the Access4You Hub to create a solution design
other application and enterprise architects to ensure that the solution fits with enterprise goals, technologies and interoperates with other identity and security systems
with IT Security and Data Privacy colleagues
Your areas of responsibility:
You are responsible for the conceptual design of our One Identity based IAM Services in a hybrid cloud environment and work closely with the service teams to ensure the solution under development is fit for its intended purpose
You are responsible for the development and implementation of an architecture that enables us to rapidly onboard our applications to the central role shop
It is your responsibility to implement a system architecture which meets our compliance requirements and enforces regulations of the Internal Control System (ICS)
You describe the System Context and System Intent, analyze technical trade-offs, determine the primary components and subsystems
You identify the interfaces between the systems, define Nonfunctional Requirements (NFRs), guide Enablers through the Program
Conceptual further development of IT-Services in a private and hybrid cloud environment using modern technologies
Design of IT-Architectures based on business process functional requirements and quantity scales
As responsible architect you work together with the Services Teams to drive forward the activities of a transition and future vision architecture
You conduct and moderate workshops
Creation and continuous update of the Architectural Runway to the agile implementations
Driving an overarching architecture vision and strategy and derivation of measures incl. pilots with vendors, customers
Consulting of the managers of the hub and also other hubs ‚Äì i. e. for an alignment of service & product strategy
Delivery of the architecture artifacts in agile projects.
Your ideal skill set / Experience:
Deep knowledge of the product One Identity
Good expertise in Solution Architecture and integration of systems
Expertise in developing architecture & product strategy
Consulting of management, also on customer‚Äôs side
Development and maintenance of target picture and architectural runway
Strong strategic orientation, but also focussing on realistic target and operations concerns
Joy to work in agile Teams
Several years of experience in architectural work and common architecture frameworks
Very good presentation and moderation skills
Successfully conducted complex IT retirement programs
Very strong collaboration and communication skills
Very good conceptual and analytical skills
High level of consulting skills
Very good English skills
International working experience >3 months

The largest ICT employerin Hungary, Deutsche Telekom IT Solutions (formerly IT-Services Hungary, ITSH)is a subsidiary of the Deutsche Telekom Group. Established in 2006, the company provides a wide portfolio of IT and telecommunications services with more than 5000 employees. ITSH was awarded with the Best in Educational Cooperation prize by HIPA in 2019, acknowledged as one of the most attractive workplaces by PwC Hungary‚Äôs independent survey in 2021 and rewarded with the title of the Most Ethical Multinational Company in 2019. The company continuously develops its four sitesin Budapest, Debrecen, P√©cs and Szeged and is looking for skilled IT professionals to join its team.
Linux System Administrator (REF668D)
Our Linux System Operation Team provides 2nd Level tecnical support to Austrian and Swiss Customers and carry out different Linux based migrations and deployments. If you have stabile Linux experiences and want to try out yourself in the operation, and also in the automation field and take part in interessting projects, you are the colleague we are looking for.
2nd or 3rd level technical support, SLES, Red Hat, Vmware vCenter, Linux, Administration, Server administration, OS Admin

Providing on-call support
solving complex problems, doing Root Cause Analysis
capacity planning, performance tuning, optimization related activities
automation related scripting tasks
knowledge sharing

BSc in Information Technology or equivalent work experience in technical field
Minimum 1-3 years experiences within supporting UNIX systems¬†
Experiences in UNIX administration, and with monitoring systems (HP OM; Zabbix; Nagios)

Virtualization platforms, like VMware vCenter
Intermediate English language skill (fluent written and oral)
Accurate, precise work, individual and group at Work, willingness to learn , ambitious personality , initiative

The largest ICT employer in Hungary, Deutsche Telekom IT Solutions (formerly IT-Services Hungary, ITSH) is a subsidiary of the Deutsche Telekom Group. Established in 2006, the company provides a wide portfolio of IT and telecommunications services with more than 5000 employees. ITSH was awarded with the Best in Educational Cooperation prize by HIPA in 2019, acknowledged as one of the most attractive workplaces by PwC Hungary‚Äôs independent survey in 2021 and rewarded with the title of the Most Ethical Multinational Company in 2019. The company continuously develops its four sites in Budapest, Debrecen, P√©cs and Szeged and is looking for skilled IT professionals to join its team.
Senior Project and Program Manager (REF1049T)
As "Senior Project Manager ", you will be responsible for overall planning, implementation, controlling and risk management of transition and transformation (T&T) , strategic and/or IT projects worldwide. With your project team, you have the end-to-end responsibility for the solution in close collaboration with the relevant departments of delivery and the customer suppliers.
Your other responsibilities include:
Leading the project, elaborating and implementing the Project Management Plan
Control of international virtual teams
Creating resource plan and staffing the project
Planning, steering and being responsible for the project regarding time, quality and cost.
Establishing, executing and monitoring back to green plans
Planning and organizing the project in alignment with the customer and the relevant T-Systems departments
Being responsible for adherence to T-Systems Project Management, Transition and Transformation and Software development standards
Defining an agreed way of change and claiming management within the project
Implementing governance and escalation management within the T-Systems and towards customer
Assuring acceptance of project results by the customer and the handover to operation
Assuring readiness of service management, delivery and billing
Guaranteeing effective project management quality gates and the handover to service quality gates
Skills:
Advanced, fluent German and English
An exceptional track record of delivering large-scale, high value projects successfully at a country or global level
Experience with classic (waterfall) and agile project management methods
Technical and IT know-how and the willingness to familiarize yourself with the subject matter
Ability to respond to customer needs with a high level of customer focus and social competence
Exceptional analytical skills
Experience in structuring, running and managing complex IT projects
Proven ability in leadership, managing a diverse range of technical resources
Good collaboration, communication and problem-solving skills
At least 3 years‚Äô experience as IT Project Manager and/or T&T Manager in international environment
MS Project and Office knowledge
Advantages
Project management certificate (PMP, Prince2, IPMA B)
ITIL V4 exam
Experience in IT Outsourcing
Experience with cloud integration
Senior
* Please be informed that our remote working possibility is only available within Hungary due to European taxation regulation.

Senior Scrum Master (REF1453J)
Tasks
Leading the agile team in Servant-leadership style helps to collaborate and interact, in order to maximize the value delivered by the scrum team
Guiding and coaching the agile team and organization on how to use Agile/Scrum practices and values
Supporting the Product Owner, with special respect to refining and managing the product backlog

Be part of a passionate team of agile ambassadors, where you can grow and help others to grow.

Present in the market under the Deutsche Telekom IT Solutions brand name, IT-Services Hungary (ITSH) is a subsidiary of the Deutsche Telekom Group and is the largest ICT employer in Hungary. Established in 2006, the company provides a wide portfolio of IT and telecommunications services with more than 5000 employees. ITSH was awarded with the Best in Educational Cooperation prize by HIPA in 2019, acknowledged as one of the most attractive workplaces by PwC Hungary‚Äôs independent survey and rewarded with the title of the Most Ethical Multinational Company in 2019. The company continuously develops its four sites in Budapest, Debrecen, P√©cs and Szeged and is looking for skilled IT professionals to join its team.¬†
Cloud Engineer (OTC) REF879F
We run Open Telekom Cloud! Open Telekom Cloud is a public cloud standard product based on open source community software and driven by principles of DevSecOps. Lean structures, agile methods, highly motivated teams and an extremely dynamic business environment determine our actions. With this customer-oriented and agile orientation, we are the anchor point for the Public Cloud business in Deutsche Telekom Group.
We are measured by delivering a secure, stable, and innovative platform. We work jointly with our platform partner and other partners out of the OpenStack ecosystem to create a highly innovative public cloud product based on European security and data protection standards.
We are looking for people who are professionals and evangelists with a great deal of enthusiasm for cloud technology and who are up to the challenges created by the development and operation of a hyper-scale public cloud.¬†
We offer a unique insight into how a large public cloud works under the hood, intercultural teamwork, flat hierarchies, and an independent working-style.
As an Engineer, you understand the latest developments in cloud and hardware technology. Customer-oriented, you will further develop the hardware architecture of our Open Telekom Cloud platform.
Tasks:
Be responsible for the structured expansion and upgrading of our hardware under hyper-scaler conditions.
Be a trusted advisor for public cloud technology.
Consistently automate with common automation frameworks.
Get your hands "dirty" without reservations.
Work in a team of specialists where everyone helps each other openly and with trust...
Requirements:
Completed studies in a technical, engineering or scientific subject or comparable professional training.¬†
3-5 years of professional experience in IT with a focus on cloud and data centers.¬†
In-depth knowledge of server, storage and networking hardware.
Strong experience in Linux and network related services.¬†
Practice in hardware-oriented infrastructure automation and asset management.
High level of customer focus.
Knowledge of agile development processes.
Ability to assess technical solutions and come up with creative solutions.
Fluency in written and spoken English.
You will be working in the European Union to meet our customers' data security and privacy requirements.¬†
Senior
* Please be informed that our remote working possibility is only available within Hungary due to European taxation regulation.

Present in the market under the Deutsche Telekom IT Solutions brand name, IT-Services Hungary (ITSH) is a subsidiary of the Deutsche Telekom Group and is the largest ICT employer in Hungary. Established in 2006, the company provides a wide portfolio of IT and telecommunications services with more than 5000¬†employees. Angular Developer for Cloud of Things (REF577Q)
Cloud of Things¬†‚Äì Deutsche Telekom's IoT platform
The Cloud of Things is our high-performance, cloud-based IoT application platform for the Internet of Things. You can use it to connect your devices and machines while monitoring and controlling them remotely. Out-of-the-box, no programming or installation (SaaS): Simply connect your devices, configure individual dashboards and get your first IoT project up and running!
The Cloud of Things collects the sensor data of your connected machines in real-time and analyzes it. And you‚Äôll always have an overview of several parameters, such as pressure, RPM, temperature or position in your personal web portal. You‚Äôll also have comprehensive analysis tools at your disposal to gain insights and trigger automated actions. It all makes it extremely easy to develop new business models, increase the efficiency of your systems and processes, reduce downtime and cut costs through predictive maintenance.
In this role you will:
Support, maintenance and redesign of the CoT Web Applications "Service&Help" and "Demo-Tenant".
Other topics/tasks dealing with CoT frontends are planned/expected.
Technical skills:
Requirements:
¬†JavaScript/Typescript;
¬†Experience in developing GUI frontends using Web frameworks such as Angular2+;
¬†An advantage would be knowing of AngularJS;
¬†English suitable for communications;
¬†Git;
¬†Agile development processes Kanban/Scrum;
¬†Confluence, Jira.
Soft skills:
Experience with working in agile projects (Scrum, Kanban)
Being curious and capable to learn new things
Being creative and proactive with finding new solutions and resolving problems
Being able to achieve good results independently and without close supervision
Being used to taking responsibility for their work and results
Good time management skills
Able to organize their own work effectively
Communication, collaboration and team work are important in our project.
Location
Budapest

The largest ICT employer in Hungary, Deutsche Telekom IT Solutions (formerly IT-Services Hungary, ITSH) is a subsidiary of the Deutsche Telekom Group. Established in 2006, the company provides a wide portfolio of IT and telecommunications services with more than 5000 employees. ITSH was awarded with the Best in Educational Cooperation prize by HIPA in 2019, acknowledged as one of the most attractive workplaces by PwC Hungary‚Äôs independent survey in 2021 and rewarded with the title of the Most Ethical Multinational Company in 2019. The company continuously develops its four sites in Budapest, Debrecen, P√©cs and Szeged and is looking for skilled IT professionals to join its team.
Volkswagen - Application Support
Be part of the team that enables Volkswagen to be one of the biggest players in the Automotive Industry.
Tasks:
2nd level support of EDI (Electronic Data Interchange) application on which major parts of Volkswagen's logistics processes rely on
Monitoring
Service Request handling via e-mails
Service Request handling in ticketing tool
Incident ticket handling
Customer consultancy
Change Coordination and Implementation (only with appropriate experience)
Problem Management (only with appropriate experience)
On-call duty (only with appropriate experience)
Requirements:
Proficient German, intermediate¬†English language knowledge
IT related experience
Precise and confident personality
Experienced
Experience in EDI support field
Experience in¬†automation projects
Experience in process improvement
* Please be informed that our remote working possibility is only available within Hungary due to European taxation regulation.

Would you like to join to a team, where you can contribute with your experiences to an end to end procedure in testing, automation and operations activities of innovative network technologies?¬†This is your turn now! Come and join us¬†and be the part of an exciting journey towards Magenta world!¬†Join our international company and help us to create value for one of the biggest and most important projects in Deutsche Telekom Group. Being part of our team, you will have an impact on our 30 million Customers, who will use our products and services.
Testautomation Developer (REF1535D)
In EMS Team of DTT continuing, expanding, and developing the first automation steps and adapting them in order to increase quality in validation, rollout and operation. This primarily includes the areas of the interface to the supplier, test environments, and active operation.
Tasks
Develop and implement automation of tests and operations in close cooperation with team
Automation of existing processes / mechanisms not automated by the manufacturer
Create sustainable, maintainable and modular solution
Performing of developed automated tests
Analysis of test runs, reporting
Participation in administration of environments
Detailed development documentation
Goals:
Reduce repetitive activities
Increase quality in validation, rollout and operation
Improve software quality through higher test coverage
Doing the best to avoid failures
Requirements
Frameworks like Postman, Ansible, ReadyAPI, Behave, VS Code, etc
Programming languages YAML, Python, Gherkin, json, bash, and the like
Strong expertise in Linux
Jira, Git
Good communication skills with a distributed team (in Germany) using various technical means, but also willingness to communicate personally with team members
English communication level, German is a plus¬†(any level + willingness to learn and use)
Good to have:
Experience as ‚Äúfixed access‚Äù network engineer, to understand the subject area well

Java developer

Present in the market under the Deutsche Telekom IT Solutions brand name, IT-Services Hungary (ITSH) is a subsidiary of the Deutsche Telekom Group and is the largest ICT employer in Hungary. Established in 2006, the company provides a wide portfolio of IT and telecommunications services with more than 5000 employees. ITSH was awarded with the Best in Educational Cooperation prize by HIPA in 2019, acknowledged as one of the most attractive workplaces by PwC Hungary‚Äôs independent survey and rewarded with the title of the Most Ethical Multinational Company in 2019. The company continuously develops its four sites in Budapest, Debrecen, P√©cs and Szeged and is looking for skilled IT professionals to join its team.¬†
DevOps Engineer (REF215M)
Tasks
Take on the clarification of requirements in the area of ‚Äã‚Äãresponsibility and adaptation of the software for certain products and services
Carry out the corresponding programming work (coding) and take on the installation, configuration and administration of the software for certain products and services
Create and maintain software documentation in the area of ‚Äã‚Äãresponsibility and support lifecycle management for the software developed for products and services by proactively contributing your own ideas and suggestions for improvement
Work on the conception of test automation and the execution of tests
Requirements
Professional software engineering experience using extensive programming and language skills (e.g. Python, JavaScript / TypeScript, SQL, HTML / CSS, Java)
Extensive experience in full stack development using appropriate frameworks (e.g. web services, REST, application server / micro services, (No) SQL databases, Vue.js, ...)
Network knowledge (CCNA/CCNP)
Practical experience in the use of modern tools for collaboration in agile software engineering teams (e.g. GitLab, Jira, JFrog Artifactory)
Experience with virtualization and cloud technologies (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, VMware)
Experience and knowledge in big data architectures and in the analysis of unstructured data
Experience in the conception of test automation and execution of tests
Very good knowledge of English

The largest ICT employer in Hungary, Deutsche Telekom IT Solutions (formerly IT-Services Hungary, ITSH) is a subsidiary of the Deutsche Telekom Group. Established in 2006, the company provides a wide portfolio of IT and telecommunications services with more than 5000 employees. ITSH was awarded with the Best in Educational Cooperation prize by HIPA in 2019, acknowledged as one of the most attractive workplaces by PwC Hungary‚Äôs independent survey in 2021 and rewarded with the title of the Most Ethical Multinational Company in 2019. The company continuously develops its four sites in Budapest, Debrecen, P√©cs and Szeged and is looking for skilled IT professionals to join its team.

The largest ICT employer in Hungary, Deutsche Telekom IT Solutions (formerly IT-Services Hungary, ITSH) is a subsidiary of the Deutsche Telekom Group. Established in 2006, the company provides a wide portfolio of IT and telecommunications services with more than 5000 employees. ITSH was awarded with the Best in Educational Cooperation prize by HIPA in 2019, acknowledged as one of the most attractive workplaces by PwC Hungary‚Äôs independent survey in 2021 and rewarded with the title of the Most Ethical Multinational Company in 2019. The company continuously develops its four sites in Budapest, Debrecen, P√©cs and Szeged and is looking for skilled IT professionals to join its team.
CMS Cloud Application Developer ‚Äì Migration area (REF851R)
Our Automation Team is looking for enthusiastic team members, with passion to participate in global development projects. We are continuously creating easy-to-use, fast and reliable software automation solutions for customers over the world. Working within the Content Migration Services (CMS) Development Team on the development and evolution of our proprietary data migration software. The role involves working in a small, agile development team specialising in current Cloud and DevOps technologies to build solutions used by our delivery team to deliver scalable and repeatable data migration solutions for our customers
Tasks:
Work within a small development team writing specifications, building, testing and documenting our software solutions
Help to define, build, and support a proprietary software platform, meeting both industry and T-Systems delivery standards and to satisfy the requirements of T-Systems customers
Manage and develop continuous development and integration of our data migration software solutions
Be part of a dynamic technical team, leading the way with the creation and implementation of configuration management and automation tools and processes.
Help to develop scaling strategies, automation scripts, and solutions to implement, streamline, and execute our data migration solutions
Conduct training sessions and knowledge share workshops with other team members
Influence current and future technology and design choices within the T-Systems Content Migration Services team
Experienced
Experience in the software development process with tools and languages such as the following (not all are essential):
.NET Platform (C# / ASP.Net / .Net Standard)
Continuous Integration (TeamCity / ADO etc.)
Version Control (Git)
Actor Model (Akka.Net)
Relational and NoSQL Databases (SQL Server / Oracle / Postgres) (RavenDB / MongoDB)
Python / IronPython
JSON, XML, XPath
Web Services and Protocols (REST / SOAP) (TCP / HTTP / SSL)¬†
Familiarity with the key components available in cloud platform solutions from Amazon, Google MS or T-Systems and knowledge of how to provision and manage cloud servers, queues, cache, databases and network components (Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform)
Experience of deploying scalable cloud solutions on virtual servers using distributed message queues, distributed cache and associated network components such as NAT gateways and VPC endpoints
Apply, if You are:
Experienced in working within a small, agile development team
A self-motivated, creative thinker with excellent communication skills

Present in the market under the Deutsche Telekom IT Solutions brand name, IT-Services Hungary (ITSH) is a subsidiary of the Deutsche Telekom Group and is the largest ICT employer in Hungary. Established in 2006, the company provides a wide portfolio of IT and telecommunications services with more than 5000 employees. ITSH was awarded with the Best in Educational Cooperation prize by HIPA in 2019, acknowledged as one of the most attractive workplaces by PwC Hungary‚Äôs independent survey and rewarded with the title of the Most Ethical Multinational Company in 2019. The company continuously develops its four sites in Budapest, Debrecen, P√©cs and Szeged and is looking for skilled IT professionals to join its team.¬†
Google Cloud Platform Consultant (REF1106S)
Multinational corporations and public institutions are our customers. We are getting the economy and society ready for the gigabit society. All over the world. With a global infrastructure of data centers, networks and integrated solutions. Are you interested in the networked future? Then show us your innovative strength.
Are you interested in exciting topics? Then join us: The Public Cloud Product Unit operates on a national and international level, for medium-sized and large companies. With the new Managed Services for the Public Cloud, we develop, market and operate agile, cloud-native, future-oriented products and services for the digital world. The market leaders Google, Microsoft, VMware and Amazon Web Services are our partners. We inspire our customers with our consulting, development and service services.
Your new task:
As a GCP Consultant you will take on exciting tasks in the rapidly developing Cloud environment from the very beginning. You like to work proactively and agilely, you like to be one step ahead technologically, you understand the developments in the area of Cloud Native Applications and Container Technologies? You like to work with the latest tools from the Open Source community? Then join our team and actively shape the development of our practice for the Google Cloud Platform (GCP)!
What awaits you with us:
You are responsible for the technical solution architecture and the development of our new Value Add Services
You will drive and promote the necessary architecture discussions to ensure that our solutions meet all Cloud Native Application Development requirements
Together with your colleagues you will take responsibility for the realization and implementation of our Value Add Services on the Google Cloud Platform (GCP) - 100%-Cloud only!
You will bring yourself and your experience into the development process in our cross-functional and international team and you will be jointly responsible for the Value Add Services developed
You provide a stable and efficient CI / CD toolchain
GCP Services, focusing on:
Anthos, GKE
Compute Engine, App Engine
BigQuery
StackDriver
Cloud Interconnect, Cloud VPN
Cloud Deployment Manager
Requirements:
5+ years of professional experience in the IT industry or telecommunications; ideally you already have extensive experience with the Google Cloud Platform (GCP) or other Hyperscaler platforms (AWS, Azure, etc.)
Distinctive practical expertise in software development and in setting up micro-service architectures, preferably in a national and international environment and in cooperation in intercultural teams
A lot of curiosity and a high interest in the latest technologies, especially in cloud, agile methods and DevOps; willingness to enter unknown territory, to make mistakes and to learn from them together.
Highly motivated and persuasive; track record in delivering results even in conflictual situations
Fluent English
Nice to have:
Google Cloud Certification
German is an advantage
Senior
* Please be informed that our remote working possibility is only available within Hungary due to European taxation regulation.

The largest ICT employer in Hungary, Deutsche Telekom IT Solutions (formerly IT-Services Hungary, ITSH) is a subsidiary of the Deutsche Telekom Group. Established in 2006, the company provides a wide portfolio of IT and telecommunications services with more than 5000 employees. ITSH was awarded with the Best in Educational Cooperation prize by HIPA in 2019, acknowledged as one of the most attractive workplaces by PwC Hungary‚Äôs independent survey in 2021 and rewarded with the title of the Most Ethical Multinational Company in 2019. The company continuously develops its four sites in Budapest, Debrecen, P√©cs and Szeged and is looking for skilled IT professionals to join its team.
Cloud Engineer (Open Telecom Cloud) - REF1554D
We run Open Telekom Cloud! Open Telekom Cloud is a public cloud standard product based on open source community software and driven by principles of DevSecOps. Lean structures, agile methods, highly motivated teams and an extremely dynamic business environment determine our actions. With this customer-oriented and agile orientation, we are the anchor point for the Public Cloud business in Deutsche Telekom Group.
We are measured by delivering a secure, stable, and innovative platform. We work jointly with our platform partner and other partners out of the OpenStack ecosystem to create a highly innovative public cloud product based on European security and data protection standards.
We are looking for people who are professionals and evangelists with a great deal of enthusiasm for cloud technology and who are up to the challenges created by the development and operation of a hyper-scale public cloud.¬†
We offer a unique insight into how a large public cloud works under the hood, intercultural teamwork, flat hierarchies, and an independent working-style.
As an Engineer, you understand the latest developments in cloud and hardware technology.
Customer-oriented, you will further develop the hardware architecture of our Open Telekom Cloud platform.
Tasks
Be responsible for the structured expansion and upgrading of our hardware under hyper-scaler conditions.
Be a trusted advisor for public cloud technology.
Consistently automate with common automation frameworks.
Get your hands "dirty" without reservations.
Work in a team of specialists where everyone helps each other openly and with trust...
Requirements
Completed studies in a technical, engineering or scientific subject or comparable professional training.¬†
3-5 years of professional experience in IT with a focus on cloud and data centers.¬†
In-depth knowledge of server, storage and networking hardware.
Strong experience in Linux and network related services.¬†
Practice in hardware-oriented infrastructure automation and asset management.
High level of customer focus.
Knowledge of agile development processes.
Ability to assess technical solutions and come up with creative solutions.
Fluency in written and spoken English.
You will be working in the European Union to meet our customers' data security and privacy requirements.¬†

The largest ICT employer in Hungary, Deutsche Telekom IT Solutions (formerly IT-Services Hungary, ITSH) is a subsidiary of the Deutsche Telekom Group. Established in 2006, the company provides a wide portfolio of IT and telecommunications services with more than 5000 employees. ITSH was awarded with the Best in Educational Cooperation prize by HIPA in 2019, acknowledged as one of the most attractive workplaces by PwC Hungary‚Äôs independent survey in 2021 and rewarded with the title of the Most Ethical Multinational Company in 2019. The company continuously develops its four sites in Budapest, Debrecen, P√©cs and Szeged and is looking for skilled IT professionals to join its team.
Fullstack Java Software Developer (FMCx)
The Public Cloud Porfolio Unit operates on a national and international level, for medium-sized and large companies. With the new Managed Services Public Cloud, we develop, market and operate agile, cloud-native, forward-looking products and services for the digital world. We see ourselves as innovation drivers and make our customers' business fit for the digital future. Our mission: To be successful in tomorrow, we need to think now about the day after tomorrow - and always together with our customers.
With this dynamic and agile orientation, we are the anchor point for the Public Cloud business area in the Deutsche Telekom Group.
Within the Public Cloud Portfolio Unit the orchestration and digital processes team is providing various products and solutions as SaaS (Software as a Service). The respective products are for example Salesforce, Docusign, Akamai but also own developments like Cloud Billing, FMCx, M.A.R.S. (Managed Application Retirement Service) and Vamosa.
FMCx is an Order Management System build for the telecommunication market. It maps complex product models and enables the configuration of offers for the customer. In addition, the system is responsible for provisioning the purchased products to the responsible backend systems.
FMCx is based on the SaaS Infonova R6, provided by our partner Beyond.
The Development process is Scrum. Our customers are in the public, government and telecommunication area.
We are looking for you to join our team: people who are professionals and evangelists with a great deal of enthusiasm for technology and who will master this challenge together with us.
Do you like flat hierarchies, and do you have an independent working style?
Do you like varied challenges in virtual agile teams?
Then you are the right person for us.
As ‚ÄúSenior Developer/Expert Developer‚Äù you will be one of the persons being responsible for the further development of the FMCx platform. You will be part of an agile SCRUM team and work together with the other team members to reach the sprint goals. You will implement and test new features and setup CI/CD pipelines for demo and production systems.
Your tasks in detail:
Experience in software development and software testing
DevOps and CI/CD are no foreign words for you
You enjoy working in agile teams
Your way of working is result-oriented
Good team and communication skills
Experience and Qualifications
Experience with software development
Proven communications skills: written and verbal
advanced knowledge of German and English, spoken and written
Technical Know-How
Git, GitLab

The largest ICT employer in Hungary, Deutsche Telekom IT Solutions (formerly IT-Services Hungary, ITSH) is a subsidiary of the Deutsche Telekom Group. Established in 2006, the company provides a wide portfolio of IT and telecommunications services with more than 5000 employees. ITSH was awarded with the Best in Educational Cooperation prize by HIPA in 2019, acknowledged as one of the most attractive workplaces by PwC Hungary‚Äôs independent survey in 2021 and rewarded with the title of the Most Ethical Multinational Company in 2019. The company continuously develops its four sites in Budapest, Debrecen, P√©cs and Szeged and is looking for skilled IT professionals to join its team.
Head of Team (Open Telekom Cloud) REF1052D
The Public Cloud Product Unit operates on a national and international level, for medium-sized and large companies. With the new Managed Services Public Cloud, we develop, market and operate agile, cloud-native, forward-looking products and services for the digital world. We see ourselves as innovation drivers and make our customers' business fit for the digital future. Our mission: To be successful in tomorrow, we need to think now about the day after tomorrow - and always together with our customers.
Open Telekom Cloud is the public cloud offering of T-Systems International with two large scale data centers in Germany and in the Netherlands. European companies and institutions usually choose OTC, because it is offering the highest security and the strictest data protection according to the GDPR from a German provider. We use open standards such as OpenStack enabling maximum flexibility and security for the future. No wonder that OTC has become a real alternative of hyperscalers in Europe, with ever increasing capacities and with doubling revenue year over year.
Your Department
In the Open Telekom Cloud Operations, we have broken new ground and created an environment in which a completely new type of product based on open source community software is driven forward with the procedures and principles of a community approach. Lean structures, agile and innovative methods and procedures as well as an extremely innovation-driven environment determine our actions.
With this dynamic and agile orientation, we are the anchor point for the Public Cloud business area in the Deutsche Telekom Group.
We are measured by the delivery of innovative solutions from our platforms and we are consistently focused on this goal. Together with our platform partner and other partners from the OpenStack Ecosystem, we are working sustainably on the further development of the platform. Security and quality aspects are incorporated into the development right from the start in order to create a highly innovative and attractive public cloud product based on German and European security and data protection standards.
We are looking for you to join us and lead a team: people who are professionals and evangelists with a great deal of enthusiasm for technology and who will master this challenge together with us.
Would you like to work as people manager of international Scrum development teams from different cultures?
Do you like flat hierarchies, and do you have an independent working style?
Do you like varied challenges in dynamic agile teams?
Then you are the right person for us.
Job Description
Ensuring the fulfillment of the team‚Äôs expected service level
Managing performance and skill evaluations of employees together with stake holders
Setting up and tracking career paths to enable personal development in accordance with business goals
Leading employees with various professional competencies
Managing daily operational tasks
Monitoring the execution of tasks, ensuring the appropriate workload / work distribution within the team
Managing resources (work schedules, holidays, substitution plans)
Employee lifecycle management including: hiring, selection of talents, performing job interviews, onboarding, regular dialogues with employees, continuous development
Transferring operational and other relevant business information towards the team
Ensuring welfare of the team: enabling efficient team work and conflict handling
Tracking the productivity and operational performance of the team, setting targets, executing corrective actions when needed
Ensuring the efficient use of corporate assets; applying proper processes, methodologies and standards
Taking the roles specified in Document Handling Policy or agreed elsewhere and the execution of the related tasks
Willingness to travel (regularly 2-3 locations in Hungary and monthly/quarterly meetings in Germany, when not restricted by pandemic situation)
Handling of occasional management processes (self-governance and responsibility)
Performing work in international teams, in an integrated, virtual work environment
Cost & capacity management
Participating in the elaboration and realization of the business unit‚Äôs strategy and goals
Requirements:
Min. 3+ years of relevant experience
General knowledge of Public Cloud concepts
College/university degree or relevant professional experience
Fluent English knowledge (C1), German is an advantage
General knowledge of business processes
Experience in deployment and operation of services
Problem solving skills
People management and leadership skills
Agile mindset

Self-dependence and responsibility
Customer orientation,

The largest ICT employer in Hungary, Deutsche Telekom IT Solutions (formerly IT-Services Hungary, ITSH) is a subsidiary of the Deutsche Telekom Group. Established in 2006, the company provides a wide portfolio of IT and telecommunications services with more than 5000 employees. ITSH was awarded with the Best in Educational Cooperation prize by HIPA in 2019, acknowledged as one of the most attractive workplaces by PwC Hungary‚Äôs independent survey in 2021 and rewarded with the title of the Most Ethical Multinational Company in 2019. The company continuously develops its four sites in Budapest, Debrecen, P√©cs and Szeged and is looking for skilled IT professionals to join its team.
Cloud Engineer with DB skillset (GCP knowledge) (REF1501J)
About us:
‚ÄãAs Cloud Migration Services (CMS) part of T-Systems, we are specializing at accompanying our customers on their Cloud adoption journey. Whether it‚Äôs a transition from different Cloud or it‚Äôs their first time moving from on premises to Cloud, we are there for them to safely guide them through all stages of their transformation because we understand what it takes to become a part of a digital future with innovative solutions.
Our mission: Shaping the safest, easiest and most efficient transformation to a digitized and cloud-native future together with our customer.
Your Tasks:
Perform various migrations between Clouds or from premises to Cloud based on customers‚Äô requirements and needs, focusing on¬†GCP
Create, define and improve processes and plans related to migration
Optimize all onboarding scenarios for customers on public cloud together with 3rd party products for migration
Work in highly dynamic, international environment and with customer representatives in the team, while serving as the technology expert
Collaborate with T-systems external and internal¬† partners¬†
Participate in the roadmap implementation and feedback to the product team
Directly communicate with end customers to discuss possibilities of migration, transformation and their optimal designs
Analysis of current setup and following that, definition of requirements
Oracle DB design/configuration on GCP (VM) incl. HA and DR setups
Oracle DB migration strategies and approaches - Oracle migration solution design on GCP (VM)
Migration support and troubleshooting additionally, but not must-have transformation Oracle DB to GCP PaaS services
Your Profile:
We are looking for an individual with strong background in public cloud technologies who is ready to help customers on their cloud journey to public cloud.
In addition, you ideally bring the following with you:
2+ years of relevant work experience with public cloud technologies (GCP), with some professional/advance certification
English Language (Fluent)
Understanding of migration concepts and migration tooling
Understanding of Infrastructure as Code and automation possibilities (Terraform, ARM templates, Ansible, SaltStack)
Some experience with Agile tooling and processes (Jira, Kanban, Scrum methodology)
Very high motivation and the ability to thrive in a dynamic environment
General ICT skills (Network, OS, Storage, Database etc.)
Basic Scripting & Coding knowledge (PowerShell, Bash, Python); Oracle"

The largest ICT employer in Hungary, Deutsche Telekom IT Solutions (formerly IT-Services Hungary, ITSH) is a subsidiary of the Deutsche Telekom Group. Established in 2006, the company provides a wide portfolio of IT and telecommunications services with more than 5000 employees. ITSH was awarded with the Best in Educational Cooperation prize by HIPA in 2019, acknowledged as one of the most attractive workplaces by PwC Hungary‚Äôs independent survey in 2021 and rewarded with the title of the Most Ethical Multinational Company in 2019. The company continuously develops its four sites in Budapest, Debrecen, P√©cs and Szeged and is looking for skilled IT professionals to join its team.
System Administrator - Citrix (REF676D)
Installing and maintaining Microsoft Windows and Windows Server environments.Changing and customizing of the existing environment based on customer requests.Ticket handling and resolving on 2nd and 3rd level.Managing and maintaining Citrix Virtual Apps and Desktops environments from small customers to Enterprise scale.Manage, coordinate, and implement application installations, upgrades and patches for applications running in the Citrix Virtual Desktop Agent machines.Analyze, troubleshoot and fix technical issues related to the Citrix environment and/or applications provided via Citrix.Managing and maintaining Citrix Hypervisor Clusters.Managing and maintaining Citrix Application Delivery Controller environments.

Established in 2006, the company provides a wide portfolio of IT and telecommunications services with more than 5000 employees. ITSH was awarded with the Best in Educational Cooperation prize by HIPA in 2019, acknowledged as one of the most attractive workplaces by PwC Hungary‚Äôs independent survey in 2021 and rewarded with the title of the Most Ethical Multinational Company in 2019. The company continuously develops its four sites in Budapest, Debrecen, P√©cs and Szeged and is looking for skilled IT professionals to join its team.
Developer - automation (REF378B)
Our Automation Team is looking for enthusiastic team members, with passion to participate in global development projects. We are continuously creating easy-to-use, fast and reliable software automation solutions for internal customers over the company group.
As a junior developer you will:
learn and develop different content and business flow migration solutions,
deliver integration services with the help of our experienced colleagues,
utilize your development skills to ensure that customer requirements of security, data recoverability and integrity are met.
Your path:

web programming

object oriented software development and scripting
database development
server virtualization and automation

software testing and implementation, version control and repository management

hold degree in IT or have completed a coding bootcamp

Senior DevOps Engineer - REF964D
Senior DevOps Engineer is responsible for entire lifecycle of Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment pipelines and Infrastructure as Code approaches. Takes account and defines automated configuration management, release management, build, test and deployment activities. Provides prototypes and concepts for further automation of assigned technology.
Tasks:¬†
Designs, develops, tests and implements infrastructure for CI/CD pipelines and IaC.
Manages source code, configuration management, release management, build and deployment activities.
Setups and manages integration with partner applications.
Conducts of performance analyses and tunings as well as error analyses and troubleshooting
Consults and implements new innovative technologies to satisfy innovation strategy.
Creates concepts for further automation of services, processes and/or operating models.
Directly support the project teams in the development, quality assurance accompanying development as well as planning and implementation of product releases
Continuously optimizes the development and system infrastructure.
Provides consulting to project teams on areas of expertise also Prototypes/Proof of Concept solutions.
Researches and develops in assigned technology, determines business requirements, proposes changes and prepares implementation plans
Skills:
Completed studies in mathematics, computer science or training in another technical discipline or similar education/work experience (minimum 5+ years)
Experience in handling and administration of and with Kubernetes
Experience in GitOps principles, workflows and pipelines
Very good Linux skills (RedHat, Ubuntu, CentOS, core OS)
Good knowledge in Network Architecture
Practical experience in the cloud environment and in dealing with IaaS platforms (preferably MS Azure, but Amazon AWS, Google Cloud Platform are also accepted)
Good knowledge of DevOps toolchain (including GitLab/GitHub, Terraform, Ansible)
Experience with monitoring stacks, such as Prometheus, ELK stack or similar
Good programming skills especially in scripting languages (Bash, Python)
Knowledge of agile software / product development methods such as Scrum or Kanban as well as in accompanying a product development team
Experience in the area of operations
Advanced English skills
IT Technical Skills:¬†
Scripting (Bash, Python)

The largest ICT employer in Hungary, Deutsche Telekom IT Solutions (formerly IT-Services Hungary, ITSH) is a subsidiary of the Deutsche Telekom Group. Established in 2006, the company provides a wide portfolio of IT and telecommunications services with more than 5000 employees. ITSH was awarded with the Best in Educational Cooperation prize by HIPA in 2019, acknowledged as one of the most attractive workplaces by PwC Hungary‚Äôs independent survey in 2021 and rewarded with the title of the Most Ethical Multinational Company in 2019. The company continuously develops its four sites in Budapest, Debrecen, P√©cs and Szeged and is looking for skilled IT professionals to join its team.

Skill requirements¬†¬†German language skill (at least B2) is a must¬†English (B2-C1)¬†General Azure knowledge¬†
(Verified certification or meet the skill requirements of the:Azure Administrator AZ-104)¬†Advantage:¬†Network skills on Azure¬†Basic scripting (e.g. Powershell, Python)¬†Familiar with DevOps and Agile methods¬†Kubernetes or any relevant containerization know-how¬†Azure¬†SQL and or MS SQL know-how¬†Infrastructure as a Service experience¬†

Present in the market under the Deutsche Telekom IT Solutions brand name, IT-Services Hungary (ITSH) is a subsidiary of the Deutsche Telekom Group and is the largest ICT employer in Hungary. Established in 2006, the company provides a wide portfolio of IT and telecommunications services with more than 5000 employees. ITSH was awarded with the Best in Educational Cooperation prize by HIPA in 2019, acknowledged as one of the most attractive workplaces by PwC Hungary‚Äôs independent survey and rewarded with the title of the Most Ethical Multinational Company in 2019. The company continuously develops its four sites in Budapest, Debrecen, P√©cs and Szeged and is looking for skilled IT professionals to join its team.¬†
Senior Software Solution Designer for Open Sovereign Cloud - REF964D
Sovereign Cloud is T-Systems' cloud offering for clients with high sovereignty needs. Clients in regulated sectors such as healthcare and the public sector are put in complete charge of their data ‚Äì on an open-source platform, hosted in Europe. Our focus is to build new product ‚Äì Sovereign Cloud within T-systems international cloud portfolio. As a Software Developer in the Open Sovereign Cloud team (OSC) working on Gardener you will help us deliver the mission of helping customers run and use services based on containers with complete data sovereignty anywhere. At OSC, we are building a core set of functionalities that will allow our regulated and sectorial customers to create and use services based on Kubernetes at scale in their choice of regulated and compliant data centers, public clouds or hyperscalers. You will be part of an exceptional team moving the needle towards making containers as the next generation compute platform everywhere. This is an opportunity engineer system on a massive scale, and to gain top-notch experience in distributed systems and cloud computing. Senior Software Solution Designer for application development is responsible for end to end solutions for customer‚Äôs demand with respect to different options on market, available internal systems, and Deutsche Telekom standards. Holder of the position is responsible to be part of the scrum team as the highest priority to drive business in order to bring value for customer.¬†Key accountabilities:Support and develop software on Open Sovereign Cloud as defined by product management and product ownersLead and work in SAFE methodologyDevelop software solutions by studying information needs; conferring with users; studying systems flow, data usage and work processes; investigating problem areas; following the software development lifecycleDevelop complex cloud secure solutions based on open source technologies (GoLang, Kubernetes) as specified in requirementsDocument and demonstrate solutions by developing documentation, flowcharts, layouts, diagrams, charts, code comments and clear codeImprove operations by conducting systems analysis; recommending changes in policies and proceduresAnalyze initial customer demand and existing system architectures to bring value for customerDefines architecture rules and specificationsDevelop solutions for complex systems with good operability and a good price/performance ratioIdentify different options for fulfillment of customer‚Äôs demand to find optimal solution with appropriate ratio effort, price, time, qualityEnsures compliance with rules and plansDesign integration of solution, application, to existing systemsPerform consulting to customer with respect to technical realization to mitigate differences in business vs technical requirementsCommunicates effectively as a designer with developers (coders, testers)Creates solution/architecture documentationDesign test driver, simulators & automation, logical test cases for test items, test infrastructure, test end & test abort criteria from release & test criteriaImplement solutionPerform lessons learned
Basic qualifications:¬†2+ years of non-internship professional software development experience3+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability, and scaling) of new and current systems.5+ years of non-internship professional software development experience.Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Golang, Java, C++, or C# including objectoriented design.4+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability, and scaling) of new and current systems
Preferred qualifications:Development experience with Golang.Experience with at least one of the following: Kubernetes, Rancher, OpenShift or other container orchestration platforms.Experience with design/architecting large-scale distributed systems preferably using public or private cloud technologies.Experience Test and Release pipelinesExperience with developing Kubernetes operators.

The largest ICT employer in Hungary, Deutsche Telekom IT Solutions (formerly IT-Services Hungary, ITSH) is a subsidiary of the Deutsche Telekom Group. Established in 2006, the company provides a wide portfolio of IT and telecommunications services with more than 5000 employees. ITSH was awarded with the Best in Educational Cooperation prize by HIPA in 2019, acknowledged as one of the most attractive workplaces by PwC Hungary‚Äôs independent survey in 2021 and rewarded with the title of the Most Ethical Multinational Company in 2019. The company continuously develops its four sites in Budapest, Debrecen, P√©cs and Szeged and is looking for skilled IT professionals to join its team.
Cloud Engineer - (OTC) REF1553I
We run Open Telekom Cloud! Open Telekom Cloud is a public cloud standard product based on open source community software and driven by principles of DevSecOps. Lean structures, agile methods, highly motivated teams and an extremely dynamic business environment determine our actions. With this customer-oriented and agile orientation, we are the anchor point for the Public Cloud business in Deutsche Telekom Group.
We are measured by delivering a secure, stable, and innovative platform. We work jointly with our platform partner and other partners out of the OpenStack ecosystem to create a highly innovative public cloud product based on European security and data protection standards.
We are looking for people who are professionals and evangelists with a great deal of enthusiasm for cloud technology and who are up to the challenges created by the development and operation of a hyper-scale public cloud.¬†
We offer a unique insight into how a large public cloud works under the hood, intercultural teamwork, flat hierarchies, and an independent working-style.
As an Engineer, you understand the latest developments in cloud and hardware technology. Customer-oriented, you will further develop the hardware architecture of our Open Telekom Cloud platform.
Tasks:
Be responsible for the structured expansion and upgrading of our hardware under hyper-scaler conditions.
Be a trusted advisor for public cloud technology.
Consistently automate with common automation frameworks.
Get your hands "dirty" without reservations.
Work in a team of specialists where everyone helps each other openly and with trust...
Skills:
Completed studies in a technical, engineering or scientific subject or comparable professional training.¬†
3-5 years of professional experience in IT with a focus on cloud and data centers.¬†
In-depth knowledge of server, storage and networking hardware.
Strong experience in Linux and network related services.¬†
Practice in hardware-oriented infrastructure automation and asset management.
High level of customer focus.
Knowledge of agile development processes.
Ability to assess technical solutions and come up with creative solutions.
Fluency in written and spoken English.
You will be working in the European Union to meet our customers' data security and privacy requirements.¬†
Senior

Embedded Firmware Developer (Budapest)
Embedded Firmware Developer (Budapest)
Jelentkezem az √°ll√°sra ‚Ä∫
Randstad Hungary Kft
Alapvet≈ë elv√°r√°sok
IT, telekommunik√°ci√≥
1 - 2 √©v tapasztalat
3 - 5 √©v tapasztalat
beosztott
Fels≈ëfok√∫ v√©gzetts√©g
teljes munkaid≈ë
angol - fels≈ëfok√∫
Do you want to work at a stable company presenting in several different industries? Would you participate in the work of a company that has a people-oriented attitude and where the employees love their workplace?¬†
Due to the continuous expansion of our client, which occupies a top position in automation, we are looking for an Embedded Firmware Developer professional.
Embedded Firmware Developer
Tasks
Development of embedded firmware for devices and sensors with focus on a communication for Industrial Ethernet
Definition of the product/firmware specification in the requirement management system
Coding, integration, testing and documentation of program code
Conceptual design of unit, integration and system tests, execution and evaluation of related tests
Collaboration with interdisciplinary, distributed product development teams
Requirements
Studies of electrical engineering, communications technology, computer science focus embedded systems or comparable qualification
Professional experience of at least 2-5 years
Very good knowledge in C, C++ and Ethernet bus systems
Very good experience in the development of embedded systems
English knowledge at communication level
Good knowledge of the corresponding tool chains (requirement management / development systems)
Experience with continuous integration and testing systems
Good analytical capabilities
Team player
Offers
Besides base salary the package includes premium, cafeteria, health insurance service, commuting support, relocation support¬†
Stable background, a continuously expanding company with a 30+-year history
Excellent work-life balance (based on employee satisfaction measurement)
Flexible working time, home office option
Professional trainings, opportunity for development and advancement
Workplace
Budapest

Our Partner is operating in a fastly-growing, dynamic and innovative sector with regional presence. The HR Director would be a member of the Leadership Team, who will be responsible for understanding of the company‚Äôs different business lines, support the commitment and also the managers in strengthening the feedback culture. The HR Director would support more business lines with different stakeholders in a position of regional responsibility. (2 countries mainly)
HR Director
Feladatok
Responsibility for HR strategy and operations
Leading of HR team (3-5 people)
Supports leadership in HR related topics
Special focus on leadership development, talent management, employee development programs, HR processes, compensation and benefits structure
Many HR roles are already at a matured level, but several processes could be still developed such as talent management, onboarding, ESG as a core value which gives the HR Director creativity, freedom to bring new ideas
Support of budgeting process, reporting, other HR data
Supports projects in HR related matters, 4-5 projects in each year
Ensures alignment and equal approach in group employee policies
K√∂vetelm√©nyek
Degree in HR / economics area
Fluent English and Hungarian knowledge
Min. 5 years of experience in HR managerial position which comes from multinational background too
Experience in regional cooperation with different cultures or background in international project management is also a plus
Advantage: project management experience in complex projects
Analytical, process driven thinking, big picture understanding of the business needs¬†
Flexibility in a fast changing environment, change management experience is also an advantage
Strong stakeholder management¬†
Strong problem solving capability, result oriented mindset
Creativity and innovation to fulfil the business needs

Competitive salary package (bonus, cafeteria, company car with private usage, company tools)

Strong, target driven leadership team, committed to grow business in Europe¬†

Senior Devops Engineer (Budapest)
Senior Devops Engineer (Budapest)

t√°vmunka, home office
angol - k√∂z√©pfok√∫
Our international client is looking for a motivated and dynamic Senior Devops Engineer to join their team.
Our partner is a strategic supplier to all restaurants, deploying in over 120 countries and over 37,500 locations worldwide. They provide software development, testing, deployment and support services for POS (point-of-sale) and related software applications that focus on the overall crew and customer experience, resulting in improved operations in the restaurants.
Senior Devops Engineer
Tasks
Support the quality of deliveries and product maintenance:
Design and maintain technical solutions
Identify technical debts and opportunities for technical improvement
Ensure that the defined technical solution is being followed
Accept stories at DoR, and deploy stories at DoD
Act as technical liaison across the squad, solving problems on a daily basis
Enforce best practices in the software development lifecycle
Creates documentation and development guidelines
Day to day activities (this is what we use, knowledge on similar technologies are fine)
Maintain Jenkins pipelines
Maintain Kubernetes clusters
Infrastructure as code (terraform, helm, groovy or similar)
Work with AWS services and help developers
Monitoring tools (Grafana, Prometheus, New Relic)
Requirements
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in computer sciences, Engineering, Physics or other with logical and analytical background
5+ years of experience in the design, coding and implementation of complex IT systems
Experience with Agile methodologies - SCRUM or KANBAN
Advanced English skills (verbal and written)
Experience in AWS architecture and systems
Experience in Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery systems and tools
Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies and learn quickly
Hands on development experience or full understanding of development pipeline and process
Offers
International team made of young and dynamic people, who like to keep work-life balance in mind
Remote work opportunity with only a few days a month in the office
Trainings, conferences, language courses, and sport opportunities
Workplace
Budapest

Our Client is a leader in one of the fastest and biggest sectors of entertainment - mobile games. Their goal is to improve and change the mobile games industry forever. They help game developers and distribution channels generate more revenue from games by expanding their reach and distribution.¬†
DevOps Engineer in Platform Engineering
Feladatok
You‚Äôll be part of our efficient, technology obsessed, and collaborative Platform Engineering team where you will be designing, building and maintaining solutions that extend their AWS cloud-based platform with new features. As part of the role, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to dive deep into all parts of their platform and participate in their journey to build a strong foundation for all of services and technology solutions.
We‚Äôre now looking for an enthusiastic and experienced individual to join their team in Budapest, Hungary. You‚Äôll be part of a distributed remote team with a strong culture of openness, transparency, and kindness. You‚Äôll have the opportunity to closely work with and learn from experienced senior team members on a daily basis. They‚Äôre a cross-functional team that combines areas of infrastructure Ops, DevOps, and full-stack Software Engineering.
Key activities
Research, design, build, improve, and automate the next iteration of the platform
Improve the developer experience of their product development teams by providing a streamlined set of tools, standards, and processes for application development, continuous integration, development environments
Build robust, scalable, easy-to-use and easy-to-understand platform solutions used by other software developers in their daily work
Implement performance improvements and optimizations of critical parts of their services
Take a key role in migrating remaining functionalities from monolithic application setup to microservices design and deployment
Create highly scalable software solutions for serving tens of millions daily request from across the whole world
K√∂vetelm√©nyek
Educated to degree level in computer science or related discipline, or relevant experience in the field
5+ years of experience in Ops/DevOps or software development
Ability to visit our office in Budapest on an ad-hoc/monthly/weekly basis
Professional working proficiency in English
Skills that drive success in this role:
Unix/Linux/Bash, setting up and managing virtual servers.¬†Managing virtual servers and related virtual cloud infrastructure is at the core of what we do.
Docker, application containerization.¬†A docker container is our standard unit of deployment.
Clean coding skills.¬†We are always expanding the areas where we apply the ‚Äúinfrastructure as code‚Äù approach. We write new code and we carefully review the code of our colleagues, ranging from small infrastructure automation scripts, continuous integration support, to more complex backend code.
Kubernetes, Helm.¬†We continue migrating more of our services into our cluster environment where deployment and other usual tasks are fully automated.
SQL, MySQL.¬†We manage and provide various data storage services to other dev teams, SQL databases are one of the main technologies in this area.
Ability to¬†decompose problems¬†and changes into small¬†incremental steps. We use agile approaches to software development, and platform is no exception. We aim to deliver changes and results in small and safe incremental changes.
A critical mindset and a strong¬†problem-solving ability. We work with complex systems using complex technologies and we rarely see the same problem twice.
Balancing¬†autonomous work¬†with¬†clear communication with peers. Every team member has the opportunity to fully own and drive their own projects, but we don‚Äôt work alone. Peers are always available to provide feedback and discuss possible approaches.
Additional skills useful in this role:
IaaS platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure, ...)

Software Engineer / Golang Developer (f/m/d) (Budapest)

Jelentkezem az √°ll√°sra ‚Ä∫
Cinemo GmbH

Software Engineer / Golang Developer (f/m/d)
Who is Cinemo?
Cinemo is a fast paced, highly successful global company, a hidden champion, located at the heart of Karlsruhe (Germany), Budapest (Hungary) and Seoul (South Korea). With our team of 200+ international people, we are creating embedded and cloud software for the next generations of In-Vehicle Infotainment (IVI) systems. Our customers are top branded automotive companies around the world.
We are working to empower any device with media. We are growing fast, breathing innovation and customer centricity. For our team we need exceptionally talented, bright people with a drive to work hard for their customers, both internally and externally. If you would like to help us get our software and cloud services into every car, this is your chance to make history.
Position Description:
As a Software Engineer / Golang Developer (f/m/d), you will be responsible for developing and maintaining Cinemo‚Äôs cloud services. This includes caching, security and identity services, and when needed frontend applications. A firm grasp of cloud architecture is required, specifically related to scalability, distributed systems and databases. Although you will not maintain build pipelines, you will be involved in deployment strategies and therefore require a solid understanding of CI/CD, automated testing and release management.
Responsibilities:
Develop and maintain Cinemo‚Äôs backend media services in Go/Golang
Define requirements for new features with internal stakeholders
Develop new functionality in microservices architecture
Integrate with internal infrastructure
Cooperate with DevOps to design and implement the needed infrastructure for a 24/7/365 operations

Must-Have Skills

Experience with Microservices

Embedded Software Engineer C++ (f/m/d)
Who is Cinemo?
Cinemo is a fast paced, highly successful global company, a hidden champion, located at the heart of Karlsruhe (Germany), Budapest (Hungary) and Seoul (South Korea). With our team of 200+ international people, we are creating embedded and cloud software for the next generations of In-Vehicle Infotainment (IVI) systems. Our customers are top branded automotive companies around the world.
We are working to empower any device with media. We are growing fast, breathing innovation and customer centricity. For our team we need exceptionally talented, bright people with a drive to work hard for their customers, both internally and externally. If you would like to help us get our software and cloud services into every car, this is your chance to make history.
Position Description:
As a C++ Embedded Software Engineer at Cinemo, you will be part of our embedded development core team. Together with your other highly qualified and motivated team members, you will work on our optimized multi-platform connected media player and high-speed connected media management software ensuring high software quality and revolutionary features.
Responsibilities:
Design and develop new features
Produce high quality code to maintain and defend the company leadership position
Maintain and improve existing software solutions
Test and ensure high software quality
Evaluate and identify new technologies for implementation
Experience & Skills:
Very good knowledge of C++ programming languages
High interest in next-generation multimedia
Experience in designing, extending and maintaining complex architectures
Very good knowledge in English
Self-motivated, proactive and able to work under minimal supervision
Good understanding of¬†detailed levels while taking account of interdependencies at higher levels

They help game developers and distribution channels generate more revenue from games by expanding reach and distribution. They went public on Nasdaq in Stockholm in 2018 and since then they have been picked by Prolific London to be in the top 5 most valuable London based gaming startup.
At the core of their business is their patented technology that makes it possible to add, modify or remove features in compiled games to make them compatible with the requirements of any store without source code change. The technology does not require game developers to do any redevelopment work and does not require access to the game‚Äôs source code. It can enhance existing applications by adding features and functionality, such as gifting, in-app billing and several other solutions, primarily to drive revenue and user engagement.

Product Cybersecurity GRC/Auditor
Your new role
Contribute to the execution of Product Cyber Security operations, incident response and investigations by documenting and managing opportunities for process improvement and best practices.
Follow up with issue owners to ensure that documented lessons learned are being tracked and remediated.
Perform Product Cyber Security operations as directed by the standard processes and procedures.
Provide evidence of audit compliance for ISO 27001, ISO 21434 and other Internal Audit requirements.
Leverage the GRC case management solution to meet audit, compliance and legal requirements.
Assist the Product CyberSecurity on Governance, risk and compliance (GRC) management.
Supports team members on risk management requests and provide subject matter expertise.
What you'll need to succeed
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Electronics, Legal Studies or related field, or equivalent experience
Experience with Cyber Governance, Risk and Compliance (GRC) and/or Project Management with an emphasis on process improvement
Fluent English knowledge (both written and spoken)
Strong attention to detail by achieving thoroughness and accuracy when accomplishing a task
Excellent written communication skills
Strong work ethic with a bias towards action
Experience with process documentation
Advantage:
Experience with the automotive sector
CRISC, CISM, CISA, CEH CISSP or Security+ certifications
What you'll get in return
A modern office in the 11th district is waiting for you to support your creativity with fun community places, cafe rooms, an own cinema and a skybar
You can be part of a successful and growing company in the field of technology
We support you with flexible working hours and home office opportunity (60 % of the working time in many of our positions)
Competitive salary and wide range of other benefits (cafeteria & bonus) are provided to you
You can learn new languages in small groups, selecting from 5 languages
We organise leisure time activities (board games, sport activities)
What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

Advanced IT Audit Analyst
Tasks:
Participate in standard to complex audit projects (strategic, operational, compliance) in accordance with department protocols
Responsible for auditing IT controls and all aspects of the related documentation, walkthroughs, testing and issue resolution
Conduct annual tests of ITGCs over financial reporting required under US SOX
Review third-party assurance using recognized standards (SOC 1 Type 2, SOC 2)
Assist in integrated audit projects by working with the business audit team
Develop effective relationships to ensure strong understanding of IT organization and the business
Support the data analytics team on different ad-hoc engagements. When required, work as part of a small team to participate in assurance reviews and investigations.
Our partner is a global leader in the chemicals industry, they are manufacturing products that are essential to everyday living.
As a high-performing, innovative company with a strong, proven leadership team and consistent positive earnings and sales, they are always looking for talented people to join their team.¬†
Expectations
2-4 years of professional experience in Internal Audit, Big 4, IT or related fields
Experience in testing IT General Controls (ITGCs), Key Reports (IPEs), and/or Application Controls
Strong research capabilities to quickly understand technologies and be able to develop audit programs
Highly motivated, reliable, accurate and able to work independently
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Sound understanding of processes, risks, and controls
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and ability to pay close attention to details
Flexible and adaptable to changing schedules and work assignments
Proficient in Office 365 applications
Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Mathematics, Accounting, Business, Finance or related disciplines
Nice to have:
SAP experience
Root cause analysis
Has obtained or is willing to pursue professional certifications such as Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA), Certified Information Security Professional (CISSP), and/or Certified Internal Auditor (CIA)
Eager to stay current with Cybersecurity and IT Governance trends
Understanding of internal control frameworks, such as COBIT, ISO 27001, NIST Cybersecurity Framework, etc.
Identify areas for improvement including simplification and automation of controls or audit processes
Experience with Data Visualization Software and data extraction preferred¬†
Offer:
Cafeteria and Private Health Care Insurance
Flexible working arrangements and home office possibilities
Structured onboarding support
Diverse career paths (people management, subject matter expert)
Development opportunities (language courses, online learning courses)
Company and team events and possibility to join social groups

Provide technical leadership to teammates through coaching and mentorship
Responsible for continuous development of the development guidelines and documentation
Contribution to continuous improvement of development methodology and processes
Our prestigious German client operates as an unique electronic and software developer competence center, specialized in the field of electronic steering systems, they are one of the leading multinational companies in the automotive industry, whose main focus is to create and provide high-tech development solutions to its partners.
Profound education in Computer Science, Information Technology or Information Systems (Master, Bachelor or comparable) or equivalent working experience

3+ years experience in Java development and enterprise solution design / implementation
