DevOps Engineer
Our client is a quantitative asset management firm founded in 2007 and currently has over 600 employees spread across more than 20 offices in 17 countries. They develop and deploy systematic financial strategies across a variety of asset classes in global markets, utilizing a proprietary research platform and risk management process. This is a private institutional investment management complex consisting of an international team of researchers, traders and technologists who constantly work toward even greater quantification and automation in the development of its trading processes. Now we are seeking a creative and driven technologiest with strong technical and programming skills, proven problem solving ability and excellent communication skills. The new colleague will work with the Core Technology DevOps team, with other technologiest, researchers and portfolio managers, monitoring and developing systems and tools to support the core production systems of the company.
About this position
Monitoring and supporting the software infrastructure and model production system;
Investigating and troubleshooting issues;
Integrating best-of-breed tools and technologies (Spark, Kafka, Zookeeper, Mesos, Docker, Elasticsearch);
Assembling platforms and frameworks to automate business processes;
Collababorating with internal technology, research and portfolio management teams;
Build, testing and deployment pipelines, software and productivity tools, monitoring and middleware, data infrastructure.
Requirements
A bachelor degree in a technical or quantitative field;
Fluent English both written and oral;
Experience working in Linux, familiar with bash scripting;
Demonstrated experience using Python and/or Java;
Experience with relational databases (MySQL);
Familiarity with existing open-source software packages and the DevOps toolchain;
Experience in CI/CD;
Excellent analytical skills and a passion for solving problems;
Able to work independently with minimal direction.
Offer
Corporation with high-educated professionals who are from Google or Harvard University;
Outstanding bonus package.

Test Automation Engineer
Our new test engineer's focus will be:
Creating automated tests on all levels of the testing pyramid
Working together with a cross-functional team to implement test development
Understanding and validating requirements from a testing perspective
Contributing creative ideas to help evolve our testing methodologies
Occasionally mentoring colleagues with less experience
Our international client is looking for an experienced¬†test automation engineer for their team based in Budapest. By joining the team, you'll be involved in the development and testing of one of their products, which optimizes the daily utilization of flights, increases user productivity and improves airline management when there are deviations from the regular schedule.
The requirements you should fulfill:
3+ years of experience in test automation (or software development with a focus on QA)
Excellent English knowledge (spoken and written)
Knowledge of Java and JavaScript/TypeScript
Experience with browser-based automation tools
Experience in API testing
Familiarity with agile practises and CI/CD
Familiarity with version control (preferably Git) and issue tracking systems (preferably Jira)
It's an advantage if you also have:
Familiarity with Docker and Kubernetes

Data Analytics Expert

Scrum Master
Job Purpose:
Ensure development teams follow scrum framework values and agile practices, mentor and motivate team to improve processes, facilitate meetings and decision-making processes and eliminate team impediments.
Key Accountabilities / Responsibilities:
Working with the Program Manager and Engineering Manager to deliver key technical milestones that meet the needs of the business:
Facilitate Agile ceremonies (e.g. Daily Scrum, Sprint and Release Planning, Refining, Backlog Grooming, Sprint Retrospective)
Ensure team engagement
Teach and coach team practices, identify and eliminate impediments
Help the team meet its goals and coordinate activities with other teams
Work with Program Management to understand the business strategy to prioritize the backlog
Facilitate the team‚Äôs progress toward team goals
Seek evidence of completion and confirm quality
Identify and manage risks
Unearth the root-cause of any potential delays, then develop actionable countermeasures to recover the schedule
Improve velocity, quality and predictability
Continuously improve and optimise processes to develop high-quality products
Manage conflicts, facilitate a healthy work environment
Key Competencies:
Self-starter / self-directed
Able to assess gaps and propose fixes for approval
Adept at engaging with and influencing engineering teams
Outcome focussed
Adaptable and able to prioritise
Comfortable with complexity and multiple tasks
Resilient to work in a fast-paced evolving environment
Strong written / verbal communication skills in English
Experience / Knowledge / Technical Skills Required:
MSc or BSc degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or similar
Extensive experience in the Agile Framework with emphasis on Scrum
Strong interpersonal skills, flexibility and focus on value creation
Experience in working across the full lifecycle of software development
At least 5 years‚Äô experience in Automotive Industry
Experience with Confluence & JIRA
Knowledge of MATLAB and Simulink is an advantage

Life Solution Designer
About our Partner:
They are now looking to expand their¬†Policy Admin Solution designer team with a LIFE Analyst to help them¬†translate business needs into IT solutions. In this position, you will play a key role in bridging the gap between business analysts, IT developers and Product Owners, and will have the opportunity to participate in end-to-end development cycles from business requirements development to user testing.
Tasks:
Client-side needs assessment, coordination, solution proposals;
Definition, documentation, communication and evaluation of business needs and requirements;
Design, development and evaluation of business process;
Preparation and evaluation of functional specifications, process descriptions, technical specifications;
Identification of problems and requirements of users and customers, preparation of proposals for solutions;
Participation in verification, test support (both business requirements and non-functional requirements)
Requirements:
Minimum of secondary education in business/IT;
5-10 years working experience in business/IT;
Knowledge of finance, preferably insurance sector;
Analytical mindset, systems thinking;
Business analyst experience (specification writing, database design experience);
Relational database model knowledge, SQL user level;
Experience in development, program design, system administration;
Good communication, problem solving skills, proactivity, openness to continuous learning.

Cisco Data 2nd Line Engineer (Magyarorsz√°g)
Cisco Data 2nd Line Engineer (Magyarorsz√°g)
Jelentkezem az √°ll√°sra ‚Ä∫
Hays Hungary Kft.
Alapvet≈ë elv√°r√°sok
IT, telekommunik√°ci√≥
1 - 2 √©v tapasztalat
beosztott
Fels≈ëfok√∫ v√©gzetts√©g
teljes munkaid≈ë
angol - k√∂z√©pfok√∫
Cisco Data 2nd Line Engineer
Your new role
Supporting and maintaining a global network for our dedicated customer 
Working closely with design architects (TDA), project managers and other technical resolver groups 
Supporting the 1st line engineers with technical information 
Solving underlying problems 
Supporting other engineering teams to find rootcause 
Willing to learn new concepts, new technologies, accepting challenges 
Home office is available in this role depending on further agreement 
What you'll need to succeed
Soft skills:
Communicating effectively and efficiently while adapting to your audience and getting the message through as intended 
Ability to comprehend and to oversee various aspects of a problem or a situation 
Focusing on all aspects and details of a task and delivering your output with a high level of accuracy 
Ability to find root causes of problems and to focus on their quick and efficient solution
Professional skills:
In depth understanding of LAN/WAN/WLAN/BGP/MPLS/OSPF/EIGRP/DMVPN/IPSEC technologies 
Advanced level of troubleshooting (end to end) 
CISCO CCNA, CCNP certification or equivalent knowledge 
Service desk experience is an advantage
Language skills:
English on a fluent level 
Any European language on a conversational level is an advantage 
What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.
Jelentkezem az √°ll√°sra ‚Ä∫
Neked aj√°nlott √°ll√°sok
 Bel√©p√©s ‚Ä∫
Senior C++ Developer (Budapest)
Senior C++ Developer (Budapest)
Jelentkezem az √°ll√°sra ‚Ä∫
EasyHiring Services Kft.
Alapvet≈ë elv√°r√°sok
IT, telekommunik√°ci√≥
3 - 5 √©v tapasztalat
beosztott
Fels≈ëfok√∫ v√©gzetts√©g
teljes munkaid≈ë
angol - fels≈ëfok√∫
Senior C++ Developer
Our Partner is a global leader in the field of machine vision. Their products are used worldwide for example in the fields of logistics, automotive/electronics industry and aircraft manufactures. One of their biggest development center is located in Budapest, where the colleagues are working in an agile environment. If you want to work with the latest technologies in an international team, please keep reading on!
About this position
tackling complex challenging problems in a software engineering team, where everybody has a passion for programming
designing/developing/testing the system software of our product
developing and maintaining applications in C/C++ (you might also have the chance to work in Python)
working with Linux kernel
traveling to Germany and to USA (it is occasional)
Requirements
at least 4+ years of experience in C/C++ experience in concurrent programming and multi-threading
team player personality and ability to handle more projects simultaneously confidence to work with large codebase (order of 1 million lines of code)
experience with unit testing/clean code/reducing code complexity
engineering degree in computer science/electrical engineering or related area
excellent written and verbal knowledge in English (you will be working in an international team!)
good presentation and interpersonal skills
keen to get experiences with the technologies like Python, Linux, Embedded Linux, Yocto
Offer
working with leading edge
machine vision technology
high energy, fast moving company with colleagues, who are passionate to work with the latest technologies
recognizes achievement with unique rewards
flexible, hybrid work

Security Tech Specialist
What you'll be doing:
Demonstrate expert level knowledge of network security designs. Ensure the designs are fulfill the customer's expectations and align with the current security principals.
Provide technical leadership for security related technologies, serving as the lead technical resource.
Work with the Customers to better understand the requirements for the planned implementations. Displays excellent Customer facing skills, as working directly with external partners.
Manage multiple project‚Äôs and various teams including implementation, project management and operation, to delivery the tasks on time and with minimal impact to the Customer‚Äôs business.
The engineer will be expected to gain knowledge and experience in other network security technologies. Maintain a very good understanding of key products ‚Äì Keep relevant certifications up to date, attending product and technology seminars and briefings.
Be familiar with the most up to date security technologies and best practicies.
Design and Implement complex security solutions in the customer's environment.
Produce the LLD/HLD documents and implementing solution are one of the key responsibilities
Home office is available in this role depending on further agreement
This role will suit you if you have the following skills:
Soft skills:
Ability to meet the customers‚Äô needs in line with the business requirements
Working with a cooperative and positive attitude in a group setting to achieve common goals is an advantage
Communicating effectively and efficiently while adapting to your audience and getting the message through as intended
Ability to comprehend and to oversee various aspects of a problem or a situation
Taking the responsibility and taking care of the consequences of making a decision
Using all data and information available to analyse and understand a situation, with the aim of supporting decisions is an advantage
Proven experience in delivering effective and engaging presentations to a variety of audiences
Focusing on all aspects and details of a task and delivering your output with a high level of accuracy
Ability to find root causes of problems and to focus on their quick and efficient solution is an advantage
Professional skills:
Experience of the minimum two of vendor skills: Cisco, PaloAlto and Prisma, Fortinet, F5 LTM/GTM , Cloud
Experience designing and deploying network and security services for large organizations
Knowledge of IP networking and security related technologies
Any Security related certifications (Cloud, Cisco,Palo Alto , Prisma Fortinet, F5)
What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

Processing Support Specialist
Processing Support Specialist 
Due to our business expansions, we are now recruiting for a resource to head our Clearing and Settlement process. We are looking for a candidate who has a clear understanding of payments in terms of clearing and payments settlements as well as cross border & domestic payments 
Job description 
Responsible for monitoring the daily settlement process for BPC and behalf of our clients. Ensuring that that all queries, problems and incidents are dealt with in a timely and efficient manner. 
Duties and responsibilities 
Proactively monitor payment processes, identify non-standard activity and exceptions 
 Verify all transactions have been executed in a timely and accurate manner. 
Complete regular management reporting according to agreed KPI's 
Identify discrepancies in settlement amounts and initiating fixes 
Analyses processes and connected issues
Resolve processing and file transfer issues
Mandatory reporting to card companies (VISA, MC, AMEX, Diners)
Carrying out any other activities allocated to the role 
Understand business, operational and technical requirements as well as solution design for production changes implemented
Take ownership and work towards the closure of the incident and request tickets assigned
Evaluate risks and dependencies of production changes, provide mitigation plan
Work with internal and external clients, card organizations, various departments, divisions and individuals
Requirements and qualifications 
Experience in Bankcard and payment processing business.
 Minimum 3 years of working experience in payment processing industry 
Excellent knowledge in Excel, Power Point, etc, having experience with a payment processing systems
Have working knowledge of basic IT. 
Strong SQL scripting skills
Good interpersonal skills and the ability to multitask in a demanding and fast paced environment. 
Accurate, pro-active, able to work independently and demonstrate strong analytical and communication skills.
English is the language of communication in BPC.
What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

Embedded Penetration Tester (Ethical Hacker)
Company
With over 200 years of experience in industry and cutting-edge technologies our Global Partner is active in automotive engineering, logistics, plant technology, steel production and much more. Our group have more than 106,000 employees in nearly 80 countries and annual sales of ‚Ç¨42 billion.
In the Hungarian development center with our engineering team of 1000 we are present as an innovative and significant partner in one of the fastest growing and most exciting segment of the automotive industry, in the field of electromechanical steering systems. With outstanding quality and high-tech developments we meet the needs of renowned car manufacturers and our developments can be found in 25 % of the manufactured cars all over the world. Our engineers work on new challenges that can change the future of automotive.
Your responsibilities
Design and support the design of test framework systems implementing product cybersecurity 
Perform cybersecurity attacks on the product to evaluate the security level of the system. 
Perform penetration tests on hardware level (communication protocols, debug interfaces, memories, Hardware Security Modules) 
Validation of cybersecurity goals and vulnerabilities exploration 
Support of risk assessment 
Support risk and vulnerability management 
Working with management to implement cybersecurity in the product 
Carrying out and attaining the mission and the goals of the business unit managed 
Continuous self-development 
Communicate regularly with other stakeholders 
KPI and periodic reports about the status of the cybersecurity test projects 
Establish and maintain relevant controls and feedback systems to monitor the operation of the product cybersecurity project team 
Your profile
University degree (BSc, MSc) in a technical field: Electrical Engineering, Computer Science 
4+ years of professional experience 
Familiarity with embedded systems. 
Advanced knowledge of C and assembly programming language 
Out of the box mindset 
Ready to learn about new technologies 
Familiarity with measurement and debugging tools 
Experience in the field of information security / cybersecurity 
Ability for teamwork 
Self-driven to improve continuously 
The ability to present the work outcome according to the audience 
Critical thinking 
Advantages
Experience in the automotive industry 
Experience in Reverse Engineering 
Experience in embedded hardware security 
Python development 
Following certificates: CEH, OSCP, OSCE, CISSP ITIL Foundation, PMP certification 
What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

Regional Business Analyst
Job Description
Coordinate and drive the successful and timely implementation of the P2P modules/platform. The ideal candidate would work collaboratively with AP Functional team members in the completion of a number of programs and projects, in addition to successfully completing BAU transformation activities in the region. Experience in either implementing ERP applications, or deep experience supporting or using ERP applications along with leadership competencies. The position requires a dynamic person who can adapt quickly to different challenges, opportunities, and programs. The successful candidate will be a self-starter who is an expert problem solver, and who works well within a team environment.
Responsibilities:
Formulate and define systems scope and project objectives through research activities and provide guidance to new or lower level analysts
Analyze business client needs, document requirements and new technology, and derive test cases
Define and analyze enhancements and assist in redesigning business processes and process automation
Prepare reports, metrics and presentations and exchange ideas/information in a concise and logical manner between business units and IT
Identify risk and consider business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment
Test systems to ensure projects meet requirements and identify system problems to develop solutions based on analyses
Resolve problems by translating business requirements into technical solutions and identifying and selecting solutions through the application of acquired technical experience and precedent
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
Qualifications:
Experience in data analysis with intermediate/advanced Microsoft Office Suite skills
Knowledge of applicable business systems and industry standards
Proven analytical, data analysis, organization and presentation skills
Demonstrated ability to manage a diverse project portfolio
Consistently passionate for research, ideation and exploration with understanding of business analysis procedures and concepts
Consistently demonstrate clear and concise written and verbal communication
Proven ability to work independently and in a team with understanding of how collaboration accomplishes objectives
Additional Job Description
7 - 10 years‚Äô experience in enterprise applications
Knowledge on Oracle ERP Procure to Pay Accounts Payable module, is preferred
Preferred experience interacting with multiple clients/users in an IT analyst role requiring strong organizational skills and business judgment.
Demonstrated ability to methodically synthesize and analyze data with precise qualitative outputs.
Attention to detail to ensure precision of data and overall quality of outputs.
Experience with Microsoft Office tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, etc.).
Ability to embrace and master new technologies and changing processes.
Can work independently with minimal supervision is required, as well as ability to work effectively in a team-oriented atmosphere.
Excellent follow-up skills with attention to detail and ability to multi-task, strong leadership skills, strong team-orientation and interpersonal skills, flexibility and strong analytical skills.
Strong written/verbal communication skills.
Ability to establish rapport and build effective relationships across functions, across regions, and across all levels of management.
Motivated self-starter with a strong sense of urgency and possesses the ability to successfully manage multiple requests in a deadline-driven environment

Software Engineer - DevSecOps
About Our Partner:
Our multinational partner, in order to become the most technology-driven airline in the world, is looking for a talented software engineer specialized in DevSecOps.
Tasks:
Build, migrate, implement and maintain environments and key technologies for COTS/SAAS apps by using the IaC principles, showing leadership towards OPS- & Security teams, and collaborate with the development team on the continual process improvement.
Build, implement and maintain¬†CI/CD pipelines and its processes to support development teams with automated testing and security scanning while keeping an eye on FinOps.
Support the migration of our critical-, but also legacy landscape from on-premises to the Azure and Google Cloud environment in line with our strategical objectives. Experience with migrating COTS to SAAS is a pre.
Design and implement the overall architecture aligned with other self-engineered products to deliver.
Take care of specification, design, engineering, testing, delivery, maintenance, monitoring, and support of the IaC landscape.
Requirements:
Preferably Bachelor degree or higher in Computer Science, Software Engineering or other relevant fields.
Minimum of 5 years of professional experience with engineering CI/CD pipelines on-premise and/or Azure/GCP environments.
Minimum of 5 years of professional experience in performing and automate COTS/SAAS environments by using the IaC and monitor everything principles, while industrializing environments.
Knowledge of CI/CD techniques and tooling (e.g., k8s, GitHub Actions, Bamboo, Jenkins, Git, etc.).
Proficient with automation tooling, configuration management and problem finding.
Experience with bringing enterprise applications to production and supporting development teams.
Experience in coaching and knowledge sharing to familiarize teams with DevSecOps best practices.
Knowledge with and experience in agile way of working (e.g., SAFe, Scrum, Agile).
Great communication skills, written and spoken (English) and team spirit.
This role requires participation in our on-call support rotation.
Available to come to the office 3 days a week, there are no formal rules about work from home yet, but most teams have a hybrid way of working.
Advantages:
Preferable being a certified Cloud DevOps Engineer for Azure / GCP / AWS
Experience in the developer- / infra related role in previous jobs

IT Production Launch Manager
Self-dependent management of complex global production and quality launch/rollout projects, while focusing on IT standards, business satisfaction and operational excellence¬†
Ensuring launch IT Production projects success in scope, quality, time and cost by controlling project budget, deciding countermeasures on his own authority within the specified project canvas and managing project risk actively

Leading the respective launch projects with the necessary departments especially ensuring handover from build phase to service management as well as controlling that all infrastructure requirements for implementation are met

Our client is a global technology company supplying systems for passenger cars, commercial vehicles and industrial technology, enabling the next generation of mobility. They allow vehicles to see, think and act. In the four technology domains of Vehicle Motion Control, Integrated Safety, Automated Driving, and Electric Mobility, the company offers comprehensive product and software solutions for established vehicle manufacturers and newly emerging transport and mobility service providers. Our client electrifies a wide range of vehicle types. With its products, the company contributes to reducing emissions, protecting the climate and enhancing safe mobility.

Senior DevOps Cloud Engineer
About our Partner:
They are a global information technology company that builds high-performance, security-centric solutions that can help change the world. Now, they are looking for a talented Senior DevOps Cloud Engineer.
Responsibilities:
Build functional systems that improve our customers' experience, mainly in the cloud and micro-services area
Deploy cloud platform infrastructure-related changes, maintain the existing code, identify production issues, and do the necessary modification according to the business needs
Work with application/product teams to identify and implement self-service capabilities
Deploy updates and fixes for the cloud platform and underlying services using Terraform
Ensure that systems are safe and secure against cybersecurity threats using Prisma Cloud, TerraScan and Checkov
Develop scripts to automate Datadog visualization
Test and examine code written by others and analyze results using SonarQube
Provide Level 3 technical support
Perform root cause analysis for production errors
Investigate and resolve technical issues
Requirements:
2+ years experience in DevOps Engineer/Software Engineer/Automation Engineer position using CI/CD tools

IT Business Analyst
Do you have a few years of experience as an SAP Business Analyst and would like to step forward and work on a complex, international project? If your answer is yes, we may have an offer for you.
Responsibilities:
Drive business process optimization with focus on improvements of the assigned applications
Create functional, non-functional and technical specifications together with business representatives
Define technical specifications in close cooperation with other IT Solutions
Develop the conceptual design and/or architecture of solutions supporting business processes in cooperation with the business representatives¬†
Provide customer care and ensure adequate quality of selected services¬†
Ensure the realization of solutions and perform quality assurance, including operational vendor management
Support project leaders in planning
Drive the integration within solutions to reduce complexity
Influence business and IT stakeholders to obtain confirmation/sign-off of new solutions and their implementation
Requirements:
5 years of IT work experience in an international matrix organization
Being a recognized expert in the assigned group of applications
In depth understanding of the organization, the work processes and the way systems and applications are used by the business partners
In depth understanding of the data bases of the related applications and their interconnectivity to the SAP ecosystem of the company
Strong experience in PP/PM/PS/MM/SD
Understands architectural issues, factors them into decisions and recommendations
Fluency in English
What our client offers:
Working from home opportunity¬†
Competitive compensation package, including bonus
Opportunities to develop within the company across various locations and roles

Offshore Project Manager
About our Partner
We are a leading global information and communications technology (ICT) solutions provider. Driven by a commitment to sound operations, ongoing innovation, and open collaboration, we have established a competitive ICT portfolio of end-to-end solutions in telecom and enterprise networks, devices, and cloud technology and services. Our ICT solutions, products, and services are used in more than 170 countries and regions, serving over one-third of the world's population. With employees, we are committed to enabling the future information society, and building a Better Connected World.
Now, we are expanding our team with 10 more openings! Romania GSC team is looking for young talents to take their first step in the career area of DOC (Delivery Operation Center).
Tasks:
end to end management of wireline or wireless (or other technical) deployment activities
transverse coordination of supporting teams to achieve customer requirements
subcontractor‚Äôs management, daily planning tracking, weekly planning meetings, partner quotation analysis.
close communication with regional customers (+weekly planning meetings with them)
daily operational issues solving
database Daily update(ISDP) , Reporting, KPI follow-up
Requirements:
telecommunication engineer in the telco deployment,
good communication skills and ability to work in team
good adaptability in an international environment
customer oriented, be nice to have subcontractor and priorities management
experience to work with a remote team is a plus
fluent in English
Language skills:
Fluent English

C Software Engineer
The following CHALLENGES await You:
Software development (analysis, design, implementation, integration) in the area of lottery systems in cooperation¬†
with developers of other components
Maintenance, support and assistance in test and operation of the system
Taking responsibility for the assigned software components
Working according to company development processes (ISO9000, Scrum/Kanban, SAFE4)
Continuous improvement of development environment and processes
Our partner has more than 40 years of experience in research and development in the field of lottery systems. They are a worldwide leading supplier of lottery products, with more than 170 employees in Budapest, and currently serving more than 400 customers on six continents.
Currently they are looking for someone to join to their team as an C Software Engineer!
You graduated of a technical college or university
You have minimum 2 years of software development experience in full time job
Technical experience:
Must have: C (or C++), SQL
Good to have: Linux, shell or Perl scripting, transaction processing systems, database, Java
You have effective problem solving skill in a multi-component system
You want to use your structured thinking and analytical skills
You are able to work in a team or independently
You would like to use your excellent English on a daily basis
If you CHOOSE THEM, they can offer:
Competitive payment package (13. and 14. months salaries, Home Office package)
Cafeteria and Health insurance
Mentoring Program, Trainings
Flexible work schedule
Indoor bike and motorcycle storage
Recreation room: table soccer, darts and sauna
Team buildings
Excellent working atmosphere
Open company culture
Economically stable and growing enterprise
Non-conventional domain: lottery and sports games

Software Engineer

Renowned Swiss and German customers from various industries and the public sector rely on their services and products. Their development center in Budapest is continuously growing so they are looking for new experts for our ongoing and brand new projects.
In your daily work, you will:
develop effective solutions for complex business problems in various industries
integrate new components and technologies into existing software systems and architectures
work on all layers of the software stack (web and mobile UI, business layer, database)
participate in important project milestones; like estimation, releases, elaboration, etc.
maintain and improve code quality (especially through code reviews)
give and receive constructive feedback
For this challenging position, you ideally have:
confident knowledge of object oriented programming (Java is a plus) and/or
confident knowledge of front-end (Javascript, Angular, React) or mobile development
good communication skills in English (spoken and written)
Nice to have:
familiarity with relational databases
experience in working in distributed teams

diverse, challenging tasks, a large variety of projects, both in terms of industry and technology
dedicated managerial support, helpful colleagues, supportive work culture
career path: further develop your skills in your areas of expertise, or try yourself out in other parallel fields: project or people management, learning new technologies

amazing social environment with friendly, smart and helpful colleagues

EDS Integration Engineer
About our partner
We‚Äôre re-examining our vehicles and what a vehicle means in the emerging world of automation, connectedness, electrification and the shared economy. New ideas, new technology, and new approaches to mobility are our business. Join a team of next generation thinkers.
Tasks:

Good presentation skills with the ability to clearly communicate to all levels within the company.
Experience with CATIA V6 tool
Experience with Electrical Distribution System or electrical systems
Previous work within a multidiscipline Engineering team
Experience of technical problem resolution.
Knowledge of System validation processes.
Understanding the manufacturing process of Vehicles
Experience with the following tools: Team Center, DT Database, ECR Database, Digital Buck, EDS-Designer
Experience with CAPITAL HARNESS or HARNESS XC from MENTOR GRAPHICS
(previous knowledge in WERS, AIMS, RMDV, ECR‚Äôs would be a benefit but training can be provided).

ATTENTION TO DETAIL:
able to be alert in a high-risk environment;
follow detailed procedures and ensure accuracy in documentation and data;
carefully monitor gauges, instruments, or processes;
concentrate on routine work details, and organize and maintain a system of records.
COMMUNICATION:
able to clearly present information through the spoken or written word;
read and interpret complex information;
talk with customers or clients;
listen well.
CUSTOMER FOCUS:
able to demonstrate a high level of service delivery;
do what is necessary to ensure customer satisfaction;
deal with service failures and prioritize customer needs.
COPING:
Able to maintain a solution-oriented approach while dealing with interpersonal conflict, hazardous conditions, personal rejection, or time demands.
COMMITMENT TO TASK:
Able to start and persist with specific courses of action while exhibiting high motivation and a sense of urgency;
willing to commit to long hours of work and make personal sacrifice in order to reach goals.
DECISION MAKING AND PROBLEM SOLVING:
able to take action in solving problems while exhibiting judgment and a realistic understanding of issues;
able to use reason, even dealing with emotional topics.
Global Technology Services (GTS) is Aegon's global IT partner that provides infrastructure services, information security and global/corporate application support for Aegon's businesses around the world.
From 6 locations in the US, the Netherlands, UK, and Hungary, we support 20+ country units and 24000+ employees in the world. Our support consists of a wide range of centralized global IT services such as programming, database management, project management, agile/dev/ops, and more.
We continue to maximize the value from having a clear digital and data technology platform strategy that extends our ecosystem, as an approach to digitization, enhancing customer experience, and improving operational efficiency.
All of these teams work closely together to provide innovative and digital solutions as well as critical technology support. This is essential for enabling Aegon's businesses around the globe to be innovative, digital and competitive, efficient, and effective, and to provide the best solutions and customer experience for our customers and shareholders.

Data engineer
AGCO, a global leader in the design, manufacture and distribution of agricultural solutions, has an exciting career opportunity for Data Engineer to join our team. AGCO is growing our data and analytics capabilities. This Data Engineer position is an entry-level Data Engineer role. The Data Engineer I role in the Proactive Customer Services team is responsible for preparing and converting raw data to analytics-ready data. The Data Engineer will apply data enablement processes for proof of concept and prototype projects in following data domains: machine telemetry (IoT data), customer and technical data.
What You Will Do:
Build data connections by collecting and processing data according to project needs.
Builds, evolves and scales out infrastructure to ingest, process and extract meaning out data.
Leverages existing datasets to fulfill data-related requests, perform necessary data housekeeping, data cleansing, normalization, hashing, and implementation of required data model changes
Prepares data for prescriptive and predictive models
Combine information from difference data sources
Analyzes data to spot anomalies, trends and correlate similar data sets.
Troubleshoots problems, identifies possible solutions, and resolves accordingly
Partner with Data Steward and Data Manager to ensure data quality
Proactively identifies data quality and processing efficiency opportunities
What You Will Bring:
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Computer Science or Information Technology or equivalent certifications
Analytical software/language skills (Python, R, SQL)
Distributed big data processing frameworks (Spark, Kafka)
Experience with cloud and data related components such as AWS Glue, Athena, Step Functions, Lambdas, Redshift, RDS, Databricks, etc.
Reporting & Visualization tools (Tableau)

Information Security Program Analyst
Governance of Application System Testing standards and policies - review the standards and
make enhancements based on application assets
Identify compliance objectives and map program deliverables to the requirements

vulnerability assessments

identify assets for vulnerability assessments scoping
Document business requirements related to system enhancements and submit for reviews
and approvals
Map out process flows for controls in systems and review for improvements to make controls
more effective
Monitor vulnerability assessment exemption and exception requests and process based on
documented system testing standards and policies
Collect information for generating and communicating responses for internal audit questions and deliverables promptly
Design and implement a solution for performance measurements on effectiveness of controls
and overall vulnerability assessment program
Analyze trends on assets security health posture and report using visualization tools for
program review with management and stakeholders
Provide timely, accurate, and actionable reporting on application vulnerability activity, trends,
service levels, and areas of concern to senior management
Document and standardize business rules for accurate compliance measurements and
tracking metrics based on application security testing standard
Work with the Metrics reporting team to enhance and refine the metrics and key
performance indicators reported to senior management and external regulatory agencies
Develop User acceptance test plans for testing changes to system enhancements that impact
governance and compliance
Serve as a Program SME and drive open issues to a closure with appropriate resolution
Update power point presentations monthly and quarterly for application security program
reviews
Train and mentor team members as needed
Weekly and Monthly Status reporting for the program

corporate information security policies

Senior Automation Developer
C√©gle√≠r√°s / Organisation/Department
Our Client is one of the leading investment banks in the world, and for their growing professional team we are looking for an Senior Automation Developer.
Poz√≠ci√≥ le√≠r√°sa / Job description
Developing and encouraging the adoption of standard approaches that:
improve testing processes (unit testing, code review process)
improve current quality control processes
help create automation workflows in a resource effective way
Identify recurring error sources to decrease the number of issues emerging after handover to Business users
Assure the continuity of business for stakeholders that utilize the automation solutions developed by the entire digital team by:
Handling incidents, urgent change requests and urgent fixes in connection with workflows that are in production
Assuring that maintenance development artefacts adhere to internal standards and policies
Monitoring and assessing the risk of outdated standard components applied in workflows that are in production
Identifying, recommending and implementing process improvements to enhance testing strategies
Creating proposals for workflow retrofit with the involvement of technology and reporting teams
Driving the retrofitting process of workflows that contain outdated standard components.
Developing automated solutions in KNIME data transformation and automation tool
Incidents may need to be addressed on bank holidays and after-hours occasionally, very rarely on weekends.

Development Project Manager (Rolls-Royce)
About Rolls-Royce Electrical
At Rolls-Royce we are passionate about innovating the power that matters and supporting¬†the journey to Net Zero. ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†¬†
At Rolls-Royce Electrical, a new business unit established in 2022, we help to drive decarbonisation through delivering innovative electric power and propulsion technology for the aerospace market. In the upcoming years, we aim to become the leading supplier of all-electric and hybrid-electric systems for the Advanced Air Mobility market.
Learn more about our Net Zero ambition:
Rolls-Royce | Utunk a karbonsemlegess√©g fel√©¬†(https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=osWO2NpdLZA)
You are joining a global team which is growing rapidly to deliver certified products to market, offering exciting opportunities to come - and fascinating technological challenges for you!¬†
At Rolls-Royce Hungary¬†around 100 super-skilled and bold engineers work on the development of electrical technology for power and propulsion solutions of tomorrow. The team competences include the design, manufacturing, test and industrialization of novel electrical machines, power electronics, energy storage, embedded control¬†and system integration.¬†We assemble and test prototypes in our modern labs, on ground and in real flight environment. While we challenge physical boundaries as we develop our cutting-edge products, efficient project management,¬†quality, innovation, and safety dance in cohesion at everything we work on.¬†
This position is Budapest based.¬†

IT Business Analyst

Our partner is a global leader focused on the design, manufacture and distribution of agricultural machinery and infrastructure. Now they are looking for a passionate and talented Business Analyst who would be an integral part of the Product Teams in the Agile Software Delivery¬†Process. You may need to travel to European countries, to the USA or to India 1-2 times a year,

Several years of professional experience (approx. 3-7 years),¬†
Relevant experience in software development,¬†

Identity & Access Management (IAM) Analyst 2 (Officer) (Budapest)
Identity & Access Management (IAM) Analyst 2 (Officer) (Budapest)
Jelentkezem az √°ll√°sra ‚Ä∫

Identity & Access Management (IAM) Analyst 2 (Officer)
The identity and access management (IAM) analyst is responsible for fulfilling access requests within a variety of banking applications and infrastructure systems. The objective of the role is to manage user roles and access privileges within compliance of set information security policies and standards.
The analyst is expected to:
Have a strong understanding of the global identity and access management (GIAM) - products, processes, resources and tools in their respective platform with an ability to review processes in accordance with the company's policies
Support Global Identity and Access Management (GIAM) operation including weekends and public holidays on a rotational basis, as well as assigned On-call emergency support
Handle complex requests and issues independently by having a good understanding of security administration processes, practices, and policies; escalate a severity issue to relevant parties and assist in resolution
Provide audit related deliverables in short turnaround time, participate in compliance and audit related meetings
Work with the team to ensure completion of Marketplace requests, troubleshooting incident issues, closure of compliance-related action items and tasks are done within operational and controls thresholds
Understand Continuity of Business and supports its application to GIAM processes by maintaining resources like process control document up-to-date, ISA accesses, etc. within applications in scope of support
Identify potential opportunities and raise to management's attention, as well as raise ideas to improve information security controls for supported systems
Maintain availability to customers, team members, escalation manager, and senior management and handle customer and team interactions in a manner that lives up to the company's leadership principles
Effectively utilize Talent Management process (i.e., goal setup, self-assessment, feedback, individual development plan etc.) to manage own performance and work on continuous development
Assist in the development of team members by providing coaching and training particularly to new team members or new team processes
Complete other tasks/activities/projects in connection with the organizations' goals not detailed in the current job description such as automation, migration, controls culture, etc.
Demonstrate particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding the company, its clients and assets, by complying with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and reporting control issues with transparency
Our Client is one of the leading investment banks in the world, and for their growing professional team we are looking for an Identity & Access Management (IAM) Analyst 2 (Officer).
GIAM Operations is a part of the company's Global Identity & Access Management group, consisting of 700 employees, located across four service centers (CSCs) in Asia, Europe and North America including 11 in-country operations. The operations is organized to have dedicated teams supporting applications utilized by different business sectors as well as platforms like CyberArk, Database, Mainframe, Active Directory, etc. Under the umbrella of Chief Information Security Office (CISO). GIAM shares the mission to protect them from access management vulnerabilities and threats to key business systems.
At our client, they groom the leaders of today and tomorrow. Take the opportunity to embark on a challenging, fulfilling and rewarding career in cybersecurity at a global financial institution.
Qualifications:
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree/University degree of any course and minimum of 5+ years of experience in an Information Security role or related field with service delivery and customer relationship management
Interprets the principle of Information Security concepts and policies and ability to apply into day-to-day work
Demonstrate an understanding of the risk associated with cyber security and the controls set in place to manage risk in identity and access management
Proven use of discretion and sound judgment on handling of information with subject to sensitivity
Flexibility to work in various shift to provide On-call, holiday and/or weekend support on a periodic frequency
Proven capability to work within a team, seeks the input of others and greets change with optimism, curiosity and resilience, ability to manage multiple priorities and adjust to evolving work needs
Understand and relates own goals to the company, business' and teams', create SMART goals and demonstrate accountability to achieve them
Consistently demonstrate clear and concise written and verbal communication in the English language as well as sensitive to audience diversity
Strong analytical skills and ability to use Lean methodology to identify process improvements; utilize Microsoft applications to analyze and interpret data
CyberArk Experience:
At least 5+ years of experience in IT production support environment, and hands on of experience in Information Security, Identity & Access Management (IAM) technologies and tools.
Minimum 5+ years of experience in Privileged Identity/Access Management and working knowledge on CyberArk.
Hands - on experience in troubleshooting and implementation of account in CyberArk onboarding with working knowledge of access control models across technologies.
Knowledge on testing connectors/platforms and other network devices. Application related knowledge on AIM WCS & ECS.
Expertise in CPM, PSM, PVWA and Private Ark for trouble shooting and fixing issues in production & UAT.
Should be a key player in terms of disaster recovery and mock drill testing.
Advantages:
Relevant experience in the following platforms may be preferred in some case(s):
For Databases: Oracle, MS SQL, Sybase, Teradata, MongoDB
For Enterprise Systems: IBM RACF, CA TopSecret, AS/400, Stratus, Tandem, Unisys, VMS systems
For Wintel: Active Directory, Wintel NAS servers
For Unix: Unix OS, LDAP
Competitive compensation package with extensive benefits:
Private Medical Care Program and onsite medical rooms in our buildings
Pension Plan Contribution to Voluntary Pension Fund
Group Life Insurance
Flexible work arrangements
Continuous career progression opportunities across geographies and business line
An inclusive and friendly corporate culture with diverse networking opportunities

Senior Full-stack developer C#/Angular
Senior Software Engineer ‚Äì Full-stack/.NET
We are looking for an experienced Senior Full-stack Engineer (.NET) to join our growing Technology team at¬† International Language Campuses, based in Budapest.
You will be part of the development end to end of the new generation of Enterprise Core Systems that support our business worldwide.
Under the guidance of our Solution Architects and Lead Software Engineers, you will develop first-class software solutions in the cloud, both on the front-end side, adopting web technologies as well as on the back-end side, evolving our micro services ecosystem based on event driven architectures.
If you are excited about tackling and solving tough problems; if you want to be part of a fast-paced work environment and work inside the support structure of a global enterprise; if you want to be a front runner in changing how our conducts business through technology and design - then this position is for you.
As a Senior Engineer you will
Build APIs and work on microservices that run in AWS.
Work in an Agile team that follows DevOps philosophy (CI/CD, Infrastructure as Code, etc.), taking ownership of your code.
Build and maintain well tested software that follows best practices.
Focus on cloud-based and distributed architectures, using event driven and Restful APIs.
Qualifications and requirements for the role
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related Engineering discipline (or equivalent)
7+ years of overall working experience on both:
NET Core / .NET.
Exposure to JavaScript / React / Web Frontends
Nice to have: WPF experience / Windows Desktop Development
Experience in using, or desire to learn, AWS
Experience working in an Agile environment
DevOps mindset
Strong knowledge of Software Design and Software Engineering Methodologies & Practices
Strong knowledge of design patterns and best practices like Refactoring, Clean Code, TDD/BDD, SOLID principles, etc.
Full-stack experience in development of complex projects, both on frontend and backend areas
Working experience in designing / developing web services and REST API development, with knowledge of micro service architectures
Mindset and interpersonal skills
You have good communication skills in English ‚Äì not just spoken but also written
You are a team player ‚Äì who is part of a successful cross-functional team having a composition of developers, QAs, BAs and admins
You love to work in multi-cultural environments
You have strong attention to detail and excellent problem-solving skills
Your benefits
Competitive salary package
Career growth opportunities
Work-life balance
Technology discussion groups
A friendly work environment

We believe that the world is better when people try to understand one another. Our culturally immersive education programs‚Äîfocused on language, travel, cultural exchange, and academics‚Äîturn dreams into international opportunities.

DevOps Engineer
Your new company
Because of the rapidly changing environment, they had set their aim to become the most data & technology-driven airline in the world. Changing our way of working, modernizing our technology stack and architecture and the right positioning of people is key to achieving this ambition. We have organized our product teams around business processes, where together business and IT are end-to-end responsible for the digital products and services that support our operation. We are looking for a software engineer with a specialization on DevSecOps, who collaboratively organize all necessary on the automation and configuration management of environments tasks to help maximize the flow of value. As a software engineer, you will work shoulder to shoulder with other software engineers, like backend specialists, data scientists, domain experts, and frontline staff to shape the future of them¬†and the aviation industry.
Your new role
As a DevSecOps specialist, you will apply your skills to change the way KLM works, driving innovation 
transforming us into a truly data-driven organization. We value both technical expertise (analysis, design & architecture, engineering, quality assurance and DevSecOps of course) as well as the interpersonal parts of the job (coaching, consulting, coordination, and support). As a software engineer DevSecOps your key result areas are:
Make use of right technology and govern architecture for the environments in line with the organizational objectives, ensuring that the right technologies are chosen to strike an optimal balance between achieving business goals, supporting the realization of functional and technical requirements, environments and continuity costs 
Build, migrate, implement and maintain environments and key technologies for COTS/SAAS apps by using the IaC principles, showing leadership towards OPS- & Security teams, and collaborate with the development team on the continual process improvement.
Build, implement and maintain CI/CD pipelines and its processes to support development teams with automated testing and security scanning while keeping an eye on FinOps.
Support the migration of our critical-, but also legacy landscape from on-premises to the Azure and Google Cloud environment in line with our strategical objectives. Experience with migrating COTS to SAAS is a pre.
Design and implement the overall architecture aligned with other self-engineered products to deliver
Translate development team needs into compelling solutions and deliver them to end users so that business value is created
Take care of specification, design, engineering, testing, delivery, maintenance, monitoring, and support of the IaC landscape
Foster a culture where state-of-the-art approaches, tooling and technologies are applied as fits with the mission of the department, the KPI‚Äôs and desired business impact
What you'll need to succeed
We are looking for passionate and talented DevSecOps engineers, for curious builders who are biased towards action, communication and are thriving in a fast-paced and international environment. We have found that people who match the following requirements are the ones who fit us best: 
Preferably Bachelor degree or higher in Computer Science, Software Engineering or other relevant fields
Minimum of 5 years of professional experience with engineering CI/CD pipelines on-premise and/or Azure/GCP environments. 
Minimum of 5 years of professional experience in performing and automate COTS/SAAS environments by using the IaC and monitor everything principles, while industrializing environments
Knowledge of CI/CD techniques and tooling (e.g., k8s, GitHub Actions, Bamboo, Jenkins, Git, etc.)
Proficient with automation tooling, configuration management and problem finding
Experience with bringing enterprise applications to production and supporting development teams 
Experience in coaching and knowledge sharing to familiarize teams with DevSecOps best practices
Knowledge with and experience in agile way of working (e.g., SAFe, Scrum, Agile)
Great communication skills, written and spoken (English) and team spirit 
This role requires participation in our on-call support rotation
Available to come to the office 3 days a week, there are no formal rules about work from home yet, but most teams have a hybrid way of working
In addition, the following requirements are considered nice to have: 
Preferable being a certified Cloud DevOps Engineer for Azure / GCP / AWS
Experience in the developer- / infra related role in previous jobs
What you'll get in return
A competitive salary depending on your level and experience
10% of your time set aside for personal learning and development¬†
An excellent pension scheme, profit sharing, and yearly bonus.
Substantial discounts on flight tickets (after 6 months of employment)
A travel allowance
Discount on health insurance
A learning budget
What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

Complexity Analysis Engineer (Wiring and Harness Design) (Budapest)
Complexity Analysis Engineer (Wiring and Harness Design) (Budapest)
Jelentkezem az √°ll√°sra ‚Ä∫
EasyHiring Services Kft.

Fels≈ëfok√∫ v√©gzetts√©g

angol - k√∂z√©pfok√∫
Complexity Analysis Engineer (Wiring and Harness Design)
About our partner
We‚Äôre re-examining our vehicles and what a vehicle means in the emerging world of automation, connectedness, electrification and the shared economy. New ideas, new technology, and new approaches to mobility are our business. Join a team of next generation thinkers.
Tasks:
Working with the UK EDS development teams you will be enhancing the teams capability in designing for wiring complexity. Creating and managing the optioning and complexity of wiring systems. Within JLR our wiring harnesses are very complex and have to be coded for every feature in the vehicle. In fact many of the harnesses are built to order for specific vehicles. Your role will be to support this process of development of the wiring complexity and to work with the team to further develop the tools and techniques to optimise the designs.
Taking multiple data inputs regarding vehicle options and markets and create complexity designs and datasets for the wiring system design and manufacturing.
Understanding and optimising the trade-offs between variants and give aways and to define methods of optioning the wiring design to aid manufacturing.
Support the development of tools and processes to further enhance the design process.
Requirements:
As well as having passion for our world class products, you have:
Experience with big data, ability to handle large datasets
Ability to logically process the data to create optimised designs.
Knowledge of Electrical Distribution System (Wiring)
Fluent English knowledge
Coding experience is a plus
What we offer:
Bring all this to the home of premium innovation, and you‚Äôll find the opportunities to further your career working with a world-class team in state-of-the-art facilities. We offer a competitive salary and a performance related bonus scheme. All this and more makes the company¬†the perfect place to continue your journey.
We are¬†committed to equal opportunity for all.

BI Developer
About our partner:
Our partner is leading the Digital Transformation of Energy Management and Automation in Homes, Buildings, Data Centers, Infrastructure and Industries. They provide integrated efficiency solutions, combining energy, automation and software.
Tasks:
Understand and collate business requirements then design, develop and maintain business Intelligence dashboards using BI toolsets such as Tableau.
The developer will also be required to communicate back to the customer in the form of regular updates therefore excellent communication skills is essential and knowledge of agile methodology is an advantage.
Requirements:
Confident Tableau knowledge is a must
Knowledge of dashboard design concepts and best practices
Analytical mindset
Experience with relational databases and data models
Knowledge of SQL (Microsoft SQL Server) and the ability to query complex data sets within a relational database
Intermediate english knowledge (both written and verbal)
Ability to prioritize / quickly adapt to changes / work autonomously
Precise, accurate work
You May Have Already, but will otherwise learn
Web development ASP.NET (VB.NET) using Visual Studio
Work experience with: Powershell, MS Excel, MS Access with VBA, HTML, CSS, JavaScript
SAP knowledge
What we¬†offer:
Multinational environment
Proper training and support from the team and other stakeholdersBeing part of a fast growing and dynamic team where diversity is leading
Employee friendly environment, good team spirit, flexibility upon agreement ‚Äì part time and/or home office opportunity
Good compensation package

Server and Network Management team leader (Budapest)
Server and Network Management team leader (Budapest)
Jelentkezem az √°ll√°sra ‚Ä∫
EasyHiring Services Kft.

angol - k√∂z√©pfok√∫
Server and Network Management team leader
Responsibilities:
Manage the group including assignment and prioritization of workload, performance reviews.
You will be responsible for the preventive and reactive maintenance of the systems, in line with the Incident management, Problem management and Change management processes.
Liaise with the Solution Architect team leader and the Business Application Management team leader.
Develop and maintain the group's professional business relationships with IT suppliers and service providers.
Monitoring the performance of the members within your team, and supporting them with a professional attitude in-line with our leadership culture.
Our partner is working to take the quality of passenger experience to a new level. We are looking for an experienced professional to join their team in Budapest.¬†As team leader, you will be responsible for managing the Server and Network Management team.¬†
The team's responsibilities include the deployment and operation of the overall infrastructure of our client, including the 24/7 high-availability campus data network, radio, voice and other communication systems, storage and virtualization server farms, cloud-based IaaS systems, and other IT systems. During the operation, Level 2 and - in the case of some systems -, Level 3 services are provided by the team.
Requirements
5+ years overall experience including 1-3 years of experience in a similar team leader position.¬†
An in-depth understanding of high availability, disaster recovery, multi-site architecture, data center design, virtualization & containerization, network technology is a must.
Candidates must demonstrate the ability to learn on-the-fly, and be able to solve complex problems.
Very good command of English (written and spoken) and native Hungarian (must have)
B category driving licence
Offers
You will have the opportunity to be a part of and manage a highly skilled team of professionals.

Java full-stack developer (with DevOps) (Budapest)
Java full-stack developer (with DevOps) (Budapest)
Jelentkezem az √°ll√°sra ‚Ä∫
EasyHiring Services Kft.
Alapvet≈ë elv√°r√°sok
IT, telekommunik√°ci√≥
3 - 5 √©v tapasztalat

Fels≈ëfok√∫ v√©gzetts√©g

angol - fels≈ëfok√∫
Java full-stack developer (with DevOps)
What are you going to do?
By applying your excellent coding and problem solving skills, and by being a strong team player, you will make the (working) life of more than 26,000 employees better every day.
As a t-shaped software engineer you design, build, improve, deliver, maintain and support the software applications in our business platform.
Next to that your contribution will help us to be(come) a truly data and technology driven organization.
Next to your engagement in communities of practice, 10% of your time will be dedicated to research and self-study, giving you the opportunity to further develop yourself.
More specifically the product team responsible for recruitment and onboarding is looking for you to help us create a new, and greatly improved, career website. You will be given the opportunity to build a best-in-class experience to truly make an impact.
Where do you land?
You will be working in the Data and Technology business platform and People, Technology and Intelligence (Human Resources). As one of the software engineers in your (Scrum) team you will work from our head office in Amstelveen (next to that we are working from home part of the
time). As a team, of around ten people, you will work closely with business and the other teams in the platform.
Our Client is a leading European airline. Their IT is a strong mature agile organization with over 1.000 internal employees worldwide ‚Äì but they are starting fresh in Budapest with a new start-up this year.
Are you looking for a chance to work in truly European spirit with their future technological developments?
Together you fly 110 aircraft to 145 destinations, bringing millions of passengers to where they need to be, developing sustainable travel and pushing the boundaries of air travel towards to the future.
Expectations:
You have proven to be an experienced, t-shaped software engineer who likes to work in both frontend (Angular) and backend (Java). With your strong knowledge about software development and technologies and methodologies you focus on building high quality applications
that are maintainable, performant and secure. Being the senior software engineer of the team, you can support the product owner and others in the team. You are taking the lead on technical topics and you make sure that we, in collaboration with vendors and other teams, deliver excellent digital products.
You are a colleague that is great and fun to work with. You have strong communication skills and you like to work in an international environment with lots of cultural diversity. You are result driven, customer oriented and flexible to change. Although it would be great if you have
all the technical skills mentioned below, we find it more important that you are pro-active, a good learner and an enthusiast for modern technology.
Furthermore, you:
know frontend development using JavaScript/Typescript, HTML5, CSS3+ and Angular;
know backend development using Java (8/11+) and Spring (Boot);
have knowledge of modern software engineering practices (clean code, design patterns);
know both SQL and no-SQL databases such as PostgreSQL and MongoDB;
know integration patterns such as SOA, request/reply (RESTful API's) and event driven architecture (JMS/Kafka);
know cloud technologies and DevOps (git, CI/CD, Azure, Kubernetes, Docker, Tomcat);
have in-depth knowledge and experience in the agile way of working (SAFe,
Scrum, Kanban);
are fluent in English (Dutch is a plus).
Offer:
a challenging role at an unique employer
plenty of room for personal development and wonderful career opportunities
lots of freedom in tools, working hours and location;
a MacBook/laptop
a good pension scheme
an end of the year bonus up to 10%
profit sharing
great discounts on airline tickets (if you have been in service for at least 6 months)
a travel expenses scheme and a quarterly duty trip to Amsterdam
discount on your health insurance;
a personal budget for sustainable employability.

Information Security Program Analyst (Magyarorsz√°g)
Information Security Program Analyst (Magyarorsz√°g)
Jelentkezem az √°ll√°sra ‚Ä∫
Randstad Hungary Kft
Alapvet≈ë elv√°r√°sok
IT, telekommunik√°ci√≥
3 - 5 √©v tapasztalat
beosztott
Fels≈ëfok√∫ v√©gzetts√©g
teljes munkaid≈ë
angol - k√∂z√©pfok√∫
Our Client is one of the leading investment banks in the world, and for their growing professional team we are looking for an Information Security Program Analyst.
Information Security Program Analyst
Feladatok
Governance of Application System Testing standards and policies - review the standards andmake enhancements based on application assets
Identify compliance objectives and map program deliverables to the requirements
Document scope of assets to be included in the system security testing standard forvulnerability assessments
Collaborate with business and enterprise architecture team to implement changes required toidentify assets for vulnerability assessments scoping
Document business requirements related to system enhancements and submit for reviewsand approvals
Map out process flows for controls in systems and review for improvements to make controlsmore effective
Monitor vulnerability assessment exemption and exception requests and process based ondocumented system testing standards and policies
Collect information for generating and communicating responses for internal audit questions and deliverables promptly
Design and implement a solution for performance measurements on effectiveness of controlsand overall vulnerability assessment program
Analyze trends on assets security health posture and report using visualization tools forprogram review with management and stakeholders
Provide timely, accurate, and actionable reporting on application vulnerability activity, trends,service levels, and areas of concern to senior management
Document and standardize business rules for accurate compliance measurements andtracking metrics based on application security testing standard
Work with the Metrics reporting team to enhance and refine the metrics and keyperformance indicators reported to senior management and external regulatory agencies
Develop User acceptance test plans for testing changes to system enhancements that impactgovernance and compliance
Serve as a Program SME and drive open issues to a closure with appropriate resolution
Update power point presentations monthly and quarterly for application security programreviews
Train and mentor team members as needed
Weekly and Monthly Status reporting for the program
K√∂vetelm√©nyek
3+ years of experience in information security or related technology experience
Experience working in an information security team defining, revising and implementingcorporate information security policies
Experience analyzing security assessments and creating metrics visualizations for analytics
Experience reviewing application security testing results from various testing tools
Project Management experience a plus
Experience with governance and implementation of security policies, standards, procedures,programs, plans and processes
Experience coordinating initiatives related to process control design and testing
Professional Certifications in Information Security domain a plus
Demonstrate an aptitude to develop and implement application security strategies and plansbased on company standards
Familiarity with security standards such as OWASP, NIST, PCI DSS, etc.
Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication
Proven analytical, influencing and relationship management skills
Education:
Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent experience

Operator 7X24
General purpose of the job 
Operator monitors and controls ICT infrastructure and electronic data processing applications according to standardized operating instructions. 
¬† ¬†Job description Duties & Responsibilities: 
As a main user of the SD manages all tickets and cusomter contacts on the first level (L1)
Receives calls from all levels of the user community and responds in a tactful and courteous manner utilizing proper telephone/email etiquett
Handle user enquiries and support requests to provide a high standard of internal customer satisfaction
Responsible of first level of resolution
Ensures proper assigment to the righ solution groups at L2 operations
Treats and follow all incidents E2E
Monitors all ICT infrastrucure (network, servers, cloud operation, etc) related environments
Monitors of multiple distributed computing SW environment
Ensures proper payment transaction handling by systems
Responsible for system alarm monitoring and daily systems/network routine checking 
Runs batch processes via schedules or on request to produce cusotmer result files and reports
Carry out computer operational tasks according to schedule and established procedures as well as system backup according to the job schedule
Verifies and isolates issues as well as root cause and executes impact analysis if aplicable
Participates in the testing and implementation process (mostly as a tester)
Distributes operation information and reports throughout the responsible organizations according to instruction
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: 
Basic knowledge on IT and networking infrastrucure and application systems
Knowledge of NOC, SD and Monitoring operation
Understanding of basic principles of e-payments and cards payments technologies
Basic knowledge of SQL scripting and queries creation
problem managment
Undestand SLA concepts
Good in comunication specially in English
Requirements: 
1-3 years experience with NOC/SD operation in the payment processing industry
Experience in payment and card processing industry general
BS degree on IT preferred
Co-operative, good sense of responsibility
Immediate available is an advantage
Shift duty is required
12 hours working period
English - fluent
What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

brutt√≥ 18.000 ‚Äì 22.000 Ft/√≥ra
Your new company

Your responsibilities

For example, you‚Äôll create algorithms and conduct statistical analysis. Overall, you‚Äôll strive for efficiency by aligning data systems with business goals.To succeed in this data engineering position, you should have strong analytical skills and the ability to combine data from different sources. Company

In the Hungarian development center with our engineering team of 1000 we are present as an innovative and significant partner in one of the fastest growing and most exciting segment of the automotive industry, in the field of electromechanical steering systems. With outstanding quality and high-tech developments we meet the needs of renowned car manufacturers and our developments can be found in 25 % of the manufactured cars all over the world. Our engineers work on new challenges that can change the future of automotive.
Your responsibilities
Maintaining customer relationship management.
Ensure coverage of internal and customer cybersecurity requirements.
Create and maintain cybersecurity plan in alignment with the project team.

Coordination of V&V activities for cybersecurity requirements.
Coordination of cybersecurity related work product creation according to the standards and regulations (ISO21434, UN-ECE R155/156).
Documentation and improvement of cybersecurity processes and information.

University degree in management or relevant technical field.
1+ years of experience in project management or in relevant field.
Experience at least 2 of the following areas: automotive / project management / cybersecurity
Knowledge of automotive cybersecurity regulations and standards (e.g. ISO21434, UN-ECE R155/156).
Excellent level of English in written and verbal.
Soft skills:
Customer communication
Proactivity
Able to adapt in new situations
Technical competencies:
Basic cryptographic knowledge (e.g. authentication, digital signature, encryption methods)

Datadog Analyst
Your new company¬†
Would you like to boost your career in an international environment as a Datadog Analyst?
Our partner company uses innovation and technology to deliver energy to our world and they are looking for a Datadog Analyst to join to their 9 people team in Budapest and other colleagues globally. You will work both on projects as well base support enhancements by providing consultation and design services in response to requests.
Your new role¬†
You should learn/understand the capabilities of the monitoring tools and gather the monitoring needs of customers
Cooperate with developer and architects to design new and modify existing components of monitoring applications
Coordinate with other engineers to evolve, employ, and enforce our architecture standards and guidelines
Provide functional analysis
Learn and apply new strategies and industry practices in IT monitoring
You will work in an Agile team
What you'll need to succeed:
3+ years of experience in the below skillsets
Datadog Consulting expert level
Fluent English knowledge in written and verbal
Desired Technical Skills:
Analytics
Communication Protocols
Domain Name Service (DNS) and name resolution of client computers
General Database
General Logic Diagrams
Infrastructure automation
Application Programming is nice to have
What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.
