Our partner company is a leading Swiss software engineering firm specializing in the design, implementation and integration of large-scale business and security software solutions. Renowned Swiss and German customers from various industries and the public sector rely on their services and products. Their development center in Budapest is continuously growing so they are looking for new experts for our ongoing and brand new projects.

They allow vehicles to see, think and act. In the four technology domains of Vehicle Motion Control, Integrated Safety, Automated Driving, and Electric Mobility, the company offers comprehensive product and software solutions for established vehicle manufacturers and newly emerging transport and mobility service providers. Our client electrifies a wide range of vehicle types. With its products, the company contributes to reducing emissions, protecting the climate and enhancing safe mobility.

Leading the respective launch projects with the necessary departments especially ensuring handover from build phase to service management as well as controlling that all infrastructure requirements for implementation are met

Software Developer (C++)
Our partner is a global supplier of intelligent automation software. The company's software allows businesses to automate and improve business workflows by simplifying the handling of data and documents.
Scope of the job:
Senior Software Developer (specialized for C++ programming language) participates in the architecture, design, documentation, development, coding, and debugging of Windows desktop software solutions in either new software products or enhancements to existing software, under the general direction of his or her direct supervisor (Team Lead).
Your main responsibilities are:
Conducting research, where appropriate and needed, to solve specific design problems
Work independently, or in a group under the direction of a team lead, creating modules, design documentation, subsystems or applications in C++ and C#, but occasionally also using other programming languages or development tools
Work on Windows operating system with various third-party SDKs
Adhere to company‚Äôs secure software development process
Positive attitude and ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Support production users
Document his or her work in English
Participate regular team meetings and/or conference calls
Effective communication and relationships with other developers and the QA team
You are the ideal candidate if you have:
3-5 years of professional experience as a software developer
Solid knowledge of the C++ language is necessary
Solid knowledge of the C# language is preferred
Demonstrated OOD experience
Solid knowledge of Windows operating system is necessary
Working knowledge of bug tracking and version control systems (TFS preferred)
Ability to work both independently and in a team environment
Strong troubleshooting and debugging skills
Experience with PDF technology
Experience with Microsoft technologies (SharePoint, Microsoft 365, Office applications)
Experience with Document Management Systems
Experience with virtualisation technologies (VMWare, Citrix, Microsoft App-V)
Knowledge of COM is preferred
What our client offers:
Good team spirit in a small multinational environment
Competitive salary package
Modern office environment in the 13th district, near to M3 metro station
Regular home office opportunity
What you need to do now:
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' and attach your English resume to us.

Machine Learning Engineer
- Bring expertise in the application of artificial intelligence to real-world problems in drug discovery and development.
- Work as a member of a cross-functional team comprising specialists in AI, drug discovery and bioinformatics. In these teams, you will apply the latest advances in machine learning to develop tools for drug discovery and development.
- Implement reproducible workflows to investigate how can AI support us as we move deeper and deeper into sub-cellular mechanisms where there‚Äôs very little data.
- Build and optimize scalable machine learning systems to extract biological truth from noisy lab measurements using state-of-the-art machine learning. Finding of how the incorporation of those can enhance the firm's drug predictions.
Our Client is building a computational model of human cellular biology, transforming the understanding of deadly disease and designing life-saving treatments for patients with cancer.
Combining molecular biology with data science, artificial intelligence and massive scale in the cloud, our interdisciplinary team works with leading biopharmaceutical companies across the globe.
They are a diverse team, driven by a shared thirst for understanding. Their data scientists, software engineers, molecular biologists and medical doctors are laser focused on unlocking complex cancer mechanisms and ways to precisely target them with efficient therapies.
- Couple of years industrial experience
- An advanced degree in computer science or equivalent experience
- The ability to implement ETL procedures combining multiple databases
- Knowledge of modern tools for ML such as Tensorflow 2, SageMaker, etc.
- Experience implementing machine learning workflows in the cloud
- An ability to work well in a research-heavy area with lot of unknowns
Nice to have:
- Experience building research prototypes for scientific investigation
- Experience with relevant research applying modern machine learning and artificial intelligence techniques to biological data (e.g., genomics, transcriptomics, epigenomics, proteomics, etc.) or clinical data (e.g., electronic health records)
- Knowledge of the pharmaceutical industry, ideally with a focus on drug discovery
- innovative enviroment
- team building events
- carrier path
- good career path
- exiting projects
- fast self-improvement
- expanding team

Your new company
The main strength of Stylers lies in teamwork. Most of us have been working together for over 15 years and the founders of our company were first roommates at university. We understand each other perfectly and thus work together with utmost efficiency for the success of our team and our clients.

Senior DevOps Engineer
Aegon Global Technology Services (GTS) provides IT infrastructure and application support services to the Aegon businesses. GTS is responsible for the provision, support and ongoing maintenance of IT operating platforms, applications and services. There is also a strong connection with external providers necessitating vendor and service provider management. GTS is responsible for driving the technology strategy and providing IT infrastructure solutions that are in alignment with business objectives and the GTS technology strategy.
What You Will Do:
Develop, Deploy and Support Cloud Infrastructure, as code artifacts or modules;
Design, Build and Maintain Cloud infrastructure and applications;
Support and deliver using Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery pipelines;
Design and Support resiliency and scalability using AWS and other cloud platforms;
Enable systems with automated monitoring and alerting;
Support the Team and Customers with day-to-day requests, Change and Incident tickets;
Support Technology stack refresh on Systems (end-to-end) when required;
Ensure automated security is built into each technology stack
What You Will Need:
Qualifications;
Four-year Computer Science or related degree, or equivalent work experience;
3 or more years of experience including 2 years of experience in supporting enterprise-level platform installations;
3 years of experience working with cloud providers (Azure/ AWS, etc..);
At least 2 years of experience with Agile development and planning methodologies;
2-3 years of experience working in a high performing DevOps team or role;
2-3 years of experience in performance monitoring, alerting and troubleshooting in an enterprise;
Strong, holistic understanding of the internet and hosting from the network layer up through the application layer
Preferred:
Experience working in roles with a strong focus on security, including automated alerting and response;
Demonstrate a strong understanding of API‚Äôs and API Security;
Demonstrated ability in automated code testing;
Certifications in relevant technologies, methods, or platforms;
Demonstrate the key critical behaviors of commitment to task, communication, customer focus, decision;
Making/problem solving, tolerance of ambiguity, planning, prioritizing, and goal setting
Offers
Very good development opportunities in a global company;
Workplace in a pleasant atmosphere with motivated and team-oriented colleagues;
Diverse and interesting tasks and projects;
Competitive salary

NFV Engineer
About our partner:
The company is a leading global information and communications technology (ICT) solutions provider.
Driven by a commitment to sound operations, ongoing innovation, and open collaboration, we have established a competitive ICT portfolio of end-to-end solutions in telecom and enterprise networks, devices, and cloud technology and services. Our ICT solutions, products, and services are used in more than 170 countries and regions, serving over one-third of the world's population. With employees, the company is committed to enabling the future information society, and building a Better Connected World. We invest over 10% of our annual sales revenue into R&D and more than 45% of our employees engage in R&D.
Tasks:
Support NFV Core project Remote delivery, according to the requirement investigate output HLD/LLD/DD. Remote commission and integration;
Troubleshoot the technical problem within test period and services migrate;
Be sure the project successes delivery;
Provide the remote delivery solution to customer and cooperate with local office delivery.

Familiar with at least one field of core network products technology: CS/PS/IMS/NFV/HSS/UPCC;
Knowledge in product testing or project delivery or design;
Familiar with mainstream servers (such as HP/IBM) or NFV maintenance experience is considered a plus;
Familiar with openstack , VMware, CloudOS is preferred;
IP certificate is considered a plus;
Can accept short period business travelling.

DevOps Engineer
Your new role
Actively further developing our DevOps toolchain and implementing new test and deployment specifications
Conducting configuration and package management
Ensuring that any operational requirements are validated by the DevOps toolchain before going live
Ensuring that our development, test and operating environments are set up in a standardised and automated manner
Actively managing stakeholders and continuously enhancing our DevOps culture
Coordinating regular platform releases
What you'll need to succeed
Degree or similar qualification (apprenticeship) with a focus on IT
Knowledge of agile software development using scripting languages (e.g. PHP) and agile methods
Experience with modern public cloud environments (preferably AWS) and containerised applications
Experience with the automation of software releases using CI/CD pipelines as well as conducting automated test procedures and using programs to create and evaluate code metrics
Experience using automation tools for orchestration, configuration and administration and with using infrastructure-as-code technologies
Strong communication skills and team spirit as well as fluency in English
What you'll get in return
Possibility to improve yourself in a constantly growing organization
Secure, long-term job opportunity at a stable company
An above average salary
Intensive, individual, and practical training
Varied and interesting responsibilities
Modern and comfortable working environment (adjustable desk and chair, sports facilities)
Home office possibility

Lead Data Engineer
Tasks:
Support the Solution and Data Architect(s) to design, build, deliver, and maintain the technical data infrastructure that is the foundation of the BI platform and support global data strategy initiatives
Provide technical leadership in data engineering good practice, drive the design patterns and practices that will achieve a scalable data integration platform that emphasizes re-usability and accelerates delivery with a focus on automation and continuous improvement
Assist the project delivery team to scope, plan and deliver new and enhanced data integrations
Use Azure Databricks for complex data cleansing, preparation, and analysis to meet the functional and non-functional needs of the business, and for re-usable data processing modules
Develop, test, and maintain Azure Data Factory pipelines and data flows to manage the extract, transform, and load of data from a variety of data sources to the data lake and data warehouse
Use T-SQL to build, maintain and enhance database objects (tables, views, procedures, etc.) in Azure SQL Database, helping to develop and enhance the Triana data warehouse as part of planned and ad-hoc development activities
Establish a mindset of innovation, constant improvement for best practices and business standards in data analytics and development, helping to turn raw data into actionable insights
Generate high-/low-level designs and technical specifications of existing and new data integration processes to the required business and technical standard
Support data science and other experimental initiatives by using the appropriate tool set including Databricks, ADF, Python and SQL to wrangle and prepare large and/or complex structured and semi-structured data,¬†
Work with Product Owners, Analysts and Account Teams to assist with data-related technical issues and propose suitable solutions, both short and long term
Provide leadership and support within the C&W BI Analyst Super User community in order to bring in best practices and innovation from other parts of the C&W organization.
Promote effective and consistent communication ‚Äì both within your team and inter-department¬†
Work closely with a multi-disciplinary team in an Agile / Scrum environment ensuring quality deliverable end of each sprint. 
Our Partner provides customized property management service, and have leading role in the market. We are looking for their expanding international team a Lead Data Engineer colleague, with the following tasks:
Expectations:
Extensive experience (3+ years) developing data integrations against different sources including flat file, API and database using one or more industry standard toolsets e.g., Databricks, Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse, Google Dataflow, Apache Beam, Talend, Spark, Jupyter Notebooks, SSIS, Informatica, etc.
Recent, hands-on commercial experience (1+ year) building data integration processes using Databricks and Azure Data Factory v2 or Azure Synapse
Solid coding experience in at least one language commonly used in data cleansing, wrangling and statistical analysis (Python, Scala, R, etc.)
Above average knowledge of using SQL to query data, troubleshoot common data issues, and summarise or aggregate data to derive new insights, extracting value from raw data
Some exposure to building and deploying cloud-native data solutions in Azure including Data Lake, Azure Key Vault, Function Apps and Azure SQL Database
Broad understanding of the principles of data warehouse design and data integration processes to extract, transform, cleanse, and prepare data for BI reporting and advanced analytics
Routine use of source control (Git, SVN, TFS, etc) as part of regular development activities, branching & merging, pull requests
Experience gathering, analysing, and documenting requirements, scoping, planning, and managing the delivery of data integration projects
Proven experience troubleshooting and resolving data, integration, and code issues. Debugging, identifying bugs, and driving them to closure by working closely with the rest of the team
Demonstrate strong communication skills documenting business processes in the form of process maps and step-by-step user manuals. data analysis, definition of workarounds, etc
Familiarity with test management (UAT, unit testing, system integration testing and release to live processes), system testing with defined entry and exit criteria
Nice to have:
Experience with Delta Lake technologies including Delta Tables, Unity Catalog, Delta Live, Spark Structured Streaming, Photon, etc.
Exposure to DevOps/Deployment Automation/Continuous Delivery e.g. Azure DevOps, Octopus Deploy, Jenkins, PowerShell, ARM Templates, Terraform, Ansible, Chef, Puppet, TeamCity, etc.
Test-driven development using common testing frameworks (e.g. pytest, nUnit, tSQLt, nBI, etc.)
Exposure to real-time integrations or IoT solutions e.g. Event Hubs, Service Bus, IoT and Event Grid in Azure; IoT Core, PubSub in Google Cloud; etc.
Knowledge of or exposure to MPP data storage including Azure Synapse, Google BigQuery, Snowflake, etc.
An understanding of software engineering principles including design patterns; proper use of version control; branching & merging; partially or fully automated release builds, continuous integration/delivery etc.
Background in delivering data-driven solutions for commercial real estate applications
Degree in IT, Engineering, natural sciences, business IT degree or in any quantitative discipline
Skills & Personal Qualities:
Excellent communication in English (verbal and written)
Curious, analytical mind, driven to solve sometimes complex problems
Committed, able to work to deadlines, prioritise and juggle between tasks.
Thoughtful, collaborative, and proactive ready to engage with stakeholders across the globe
High attention to detail and extremely organized, diligent, and focused
Able to communicate effectively at all levels, including the ability to negotiate and resolve conflict; build & maintain effective working relationships with internal and external personnel
Commitment to quality, strong sense of ownership and a thorough approach to work.¬†
Demonstrate flexibility and ability to deliver, good team player, also able to work independently
Ability to understand the mechanics and dependencies of complex technical systems and architectures.

International environment

Service Desk Agent- German-speaking
Our partner is one of the world's leading IT professional services companies. Be part of a great international team, apply today!¬†
Responsibilities:
Providing 1 and 1.5-level support (analysis and check on possible solutions) for applications in scope
Using ticketing tool
Coordinating the German end-user resolution in cooperation with the other English-speaking support units
Communicating updates regarding major incidents to users
Running reports on active users on a quarterly basis and verifying with managers
Requirements:
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in German and at least upper-intermediate English
At least High School degree
Flexible, open-minded personality with a "can do" attitude
Have desire to learn - no IT background required, training will provide the necessary technical knowledge.
Are open to work in shifts.
What our client offers:
Competitive salary and cafeteria benefits
Free sport allowance (near the office buildings), All You Can Move SportPass¬†
High value awards and recognitions, annual bonus and quarterly promotions for top performers
Current home office possibility and potentially hybrid model of working in the future
Fancy office environment in Budapest
Training and continuous learning and certification opportunities¬†
Multilingual environment, native colleagues¬†
Pleasant and inspiring working atmosphere with multicultural community¬†
Easy to access location and modern office building
Reimbursable language courses
Team events and Company events (cool and youthful parties with team-games, etc.)

Client Service Manager
Tasks:
Active participation in projects (together with project managers), taking over the non engineering related project communication with clients
Improve the "client experience" within our projects, with maintaining good response times, understand priorities, and provide regular feedback to project stakeholders
Active monitoring of project scope fulfillment, upon need facilitate scope and contract negotiations, manage change requests
Preparation of project controlling and reporting
Regurarly visiting our key clients, actively support for Business Development with delivering leads
Our partners provides a full range of engineering services in automation and custom made machinery in the automotive and nuclear industries.¬†
Expectations:
3-5 years of Project Management experience in larger projects
Effective written and oral communication skills both in Hungarian and English
Good negotiation abilities and a solid set of soft skills in project management
Sound problem solving ability, result-oriented and creative thinking
Ability to work independently, precisely to high standards
Strong team spirit
Advantages for applicants with:
Project experience in multinational environment

German language skills
Offer:
Challenging work, diverse tasks at a young and dynamic team
Opportunity for career and personal development
Friendly, family and employee oriented working environment
Secure, long-term job opportunity with a company over 30 years in business
Competitive salary and benefit package that is commensurate with performance

German-speaking L1.5 Service Desk Agent
Our partner is one of the world's leading IT professional services companies. Be part of a great international team, apply today!¬†
Responsibilities:
Provide 1.5 level support (analysis and check on possible solutions) for applications in scope
Application and IT infra support
Provide elevated level of technical support and resolution
Provide detailed documentation about the reported issues in the ITSM tool
Receive and handle customer problem escalations
Understand, use and critically assess the contents of the knowledge base platforms
Provide remote assistance support
Requirements:
Have at least 3 years relevant experience in IT Help Desk
Fluency in German + English language is a must
Motivation to acquire knowledge about various types of applications and business processes
Must be eager to learn and understand complex IT infrastructure and operation procedures
Strong documentation and troubleshooting skills
Excellent client-facing communication skills
What our client offers:
Competitive salary and cafeteria benefits
Free sport allowance (near the office buildings), All You Can Move SportPass¬†
High value awards and recognitions, annual bonus and quarterly promotions for top performers
Current home office possibility and potentially hybrid model of working in the future
Fancy office environment in Budapest
Training and continuous learning and certification opportunities¬†
Multilingual environment, native colleagues¬†
Pleasant and inspiring working atmosphere with multicultural community¬†
Easy to access location and modern office building
Reimbursable language courses
Team events and Company events (cool and youthful parties with team-games, etc.)

Quantitative Developer
About our Partner:
Our partner has become a key player in the RegTech industry in the past few years and they are providing solutions for a variety of clients from the insurance and asset management sectors. This decision created a high demand for talented and motivated individuals to participate in them success story and be a key-player in the years to come. They aim to be the market leader, by utilizing best-inclass financial expertise and industry-leading technology.
Tasks:
Working on different client projects related to regulatory client reporting, risk management, and asset pricing;
Developing our internal libraries (regulatory reporting and risk management framework);
Understanding different third-party data structures and integrating it to the already existing codebase;
Supporting the Reporting Operations Team.
Requirements:
MSc or PhD in a quantitative subject (Quantitative Finance, Actuarial Sciences, Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science);
Multiple years of experience in a similar role;
Interest and knowledge of quantitative finance, financial market instruments and portfolios;
Strong programming knowledge in Python (familiarity with Numpy/Pandas/Quantlib packages is an advantage); alternatively, knowledge of a high-level computing language (Matlab or R) and an object-oriented language (e.g. Java/C#/C++) and willingness to learn Python;
Strong written and oral proficiency in English;
Entrepreneurial spirit, self-motivated and great team player.

SAP Expert in Intralogistics
Process-/ SAP In-house Expert Intralogistics
(distribution logistics)
Job description:
Take over a role as SAP in-house expert in the area of intralogistics for the Power Tools Division warehouse locations¬†e.g. local and regional distribution centers. This includes all warehouse related processes from goods receipt, put away, warehouse internal processes through to picking, packing, goods issue and shipping. Focus would be the integration of SAP and non-SAP¬†warehouse management systems¬†such as¬†SAP-WM, SAP-EWM, SAP-IM and custom WM systems.
Support IT projects and supply chain process improvement initiatives by defining business requirements, documenting processes and process changes, conducting tests, supporting key user trainings as well as providing user and process documentations.
Contribute to a stable operational environment by supporting our key user community e.g. as third level support contact
Closely collaborate with our IT-service providers, user departments and stakeholders.
Secure a sustainable implementation and compliance of the process standards in our warehouses worldwide
Monitor relevant key performance indicators, initiate and manage implementation and transformation programs to build or improve our processes
Intensive communication, collaboration and change management in an¬†international environment
What makes you the perfect candidate:
Relevant university degree (Bsc) in Business Administration, Computer Science or Business Informatics, preferably focus on logistics
Minimum 3 years work experience in consulting or industry, preferably consumer goods industry experience
SAP R/3 knowledge in logistics modules e.g. SAP-LE, SAP-WM, SAP-IM.
Experience in SAP implementation projects (e.g. as sub-project leader, key user or consultant)
Supply Chain Management knowledge
Project Management skills
Ready to work in an international environment
Good communication skills, fluent in English
S/4HANA-EWM knowhow would be an advantage

Access Manager Specialist (Senior)
As an internationally positioned IT team, we support the Client's product development by providing applications and solutions for mechanical and software development and for the management of development data. In this processes, we count more than 6,000 users among our internal customers.
We operate in a very heterogeneous environment of applications, such as CATIA Mechanical Design, MS Project Server, JIRA, GIT Software Management, Doors NG Requirements Management, and our PLM system CIM Database.
To strengthen our team we are looking for a qualified and motivated IT specialist at our location in Budapest.
We offer an exciting work environment in a globally operating enterprise with many various opportunities for your own personal and professional growth.
Tasks
Definition of role concepts and creation of roles for all critical applications (such as SAP, ERP, HR, SAC, S/4HANA, Fiori, BW and Solution Manager);
Quality control and continuous improvement of the processes;
Regular reporting to the service/application owner;
Handover and training of the roles to the service desk, as well as monitoring of the service;
Performance of user administration activities for user IDs and roles in SAP and other application systems in scope;
Assure those access authorizations respect the Corporate Governance procedures;
Ensuring the availability of the necessary documentation of user access requests and their approvals and corresponding processing of these requests;
Support of IT projects, providing the necessary user administration activities during all project phases. Ensure a smooth transition into operations;
Providing support for the Internal and External Audit
Requirements
University degree in a business or technical field (or comparable qualification/experiences)
Minimum of four years of professional business and technical experience within the Users & Authorisations area of SAP R/3 system with an international background.¬†
Experience in the SAP system landscape, preferably ERP, HR, SAC, S/4HANA, Fiori, and Solution Manager.
Good knowledge of SAP products administration and their integration with other software systems
S/4 HANA knowledge would be an advantage
Fluency in in English

Lead LV and HV Power System Engineer
About our partner:
We‚Äôre re-examining our vehicles and what a vehicle means in the emerging world of automation, connectedness, electrification and the shared economy. New ideas, new technology, and new approaches to mobility are our business. Join a team of next generation thinkers.
Tasks:
The Power Architecture team designs and delivers low voltage (LV) and hazardous voltage (HV) power supply systems for Jaguar Land Rover vehicles. We have responsibility for LV and HV power supply systems on all JLR powertrain variants, from conventional internal combustion engine (ICE) to mild-hybrid (MHEV), plug-in-hybrid (PHEV) and battery electric vehicles(BEV). Power Architecture is a rapid growth area and is a key enabler for Electrification and ADAS.
The Lead LV and HV Power System Engineeris responsible for the design, verification and validation of LV and HV Power Supply Systems.
As part of the team your role will be to ensure the following:
Design and development of new LV and HV power supply system architectures
Development and execution of power supply system Design Validation (DV) plans
Creation and documentation of power supply system requirements, test cases and test procedures ‚àô Power supply system issue resolution (pre and post J#1)
Ensuring compliance with Regulations and Standards (internal and external)
Delivering tasks and projects on time and on budget
Requirements:
Technical knowledge and experience of LV and/or HV power supply systems design and/or validation
Experience of system-level and/or component-level issue resolution and practical ability
Ability to communicate complex technical concepts, data and conclusions within the team and to stakeholders
Electrical or electronics engineering degree (or equivalent)
Knowledge and understanding of systems engineering principles (including MBSE & SysML)
Knowledge and experience of the product creation process
Knowledge and experience of power system protection, load flow, harmonic and transient analysis
Knowledge and experience of power electronics components
Knowledge and experience of energy storage components
Experience of structured problem solving (8D)
Experience of failure mode avoidance (including DFMEA)
Knowledge and experience of functional safety (ISO 26262)
Knowledge and experience of other systems (electric propulsion, ADAS, steering, braking etc)
Proficient in MATLAB/Simulink
Requirements Management using DOORS/TRM
Experience of CAN/LIN & Flexray tools such as CANaylzer and CANape
What we offer:
Bring all this to the home of premium innovation, and you‚Äôll find the opportunities to further your career working with a world-class team in state-of-the-art facilities. We offer a competitiv salary and a performance related bonus scheme. All this and more makes the company is¬†the perfect place to continue your journey.
We are¬†committed to equal opportunity for all.

Jelentkezem az √°ll√°sra ‚Ä∫

angol - k√∂z√©pfok√∫
Senior BI Data Analyst
The BI Data Analyst will support an agile development team consisting of data governance team members, data modelers, and BI developers. They will act as business analyst on the team for the data related initiatives and lead data analysis troubleshooting for data requests and reports. The analyst will assist in the development of recommendations, communications, and process improvements based on findings and insights and will serve as an expert resource on data and the data model and help coordinate analysis.
Support The BI/reporting Lead
BI Responsibilities
Transforms client requests into data deliverables with the lead data architect to include data models, data mappings and data transformation rules by working closely with Data Architect to provide input to new data models.
Provide data extraction, reports, dashboards, analysis, and consultation services across organization.
Participates in the development of reports/dashboards
Participates in the troubleshooting of data warehouse refresh issues.
Act as scrum master for the team and prepare detailed stories for developers.
Independently Works On
Identify reporting and data analysis needs.
Logs, tracks, and manages issues and requests in Azure Dev Ops.
Perform ad-hoc analysis and present results in a clear and user-friendly manner
Performs testing, issue resolution and works with developers to automate testing/data validation
Lead requirements workshops and User Acceptance Testing for new data solutions
Troubleshoot and help resolve reporting issues and approved BI help desk requests
Maintains the BI Wiki knowledgebase articles and actively participates in maintaining support policies and procedures.
Maintains and initiates BI technical documentation.
Create test cases and perform quality validation of data warehouse content to ensure accuracy.
Analyze code in BI tools (e.g., PowerBI, Tableau) to determine data usage and assist with determining the data usage accuracy.
Create and improve documentation that allows stakeholders to understand the steps of a process or reports.
Create data flow diagrams to illustrate data lineage and mapping from the data warehouse to end-point publication.
Supporting The Data Governance Lead
Data Governance Responsibilities
Support the roll-out of newly updated data governance policies across all the key data disciplines for multiple departments include (not limited to): Key Data Element identification, data lineage capture, Data Quality rule development, Data Consolidation rules.
Conduct data profiling to identify data quality issues and work with Business and IT teams to resolve the issues.
Participate in metadata collection and contribute to metadata catalog, business glossary to manage the definition and tracing of lineage of critical-data-elements.
Perform data profiling and analysis to interpret current data, analyze and derive enterprise reference values and recommend data quality rules
Work on processes for data quality management including profiling, exception handling, workflow, and metrics. Support data quality issues resolution and monitoring activities.
Validate data by verifying against requirements and success criteria.
Participate in integration analysis across data sources and targets by performing source data analysis, understanding data model, and developing source to target mapping documentation.
Partner with business teams and stakeholders to understand data requirements and perform data analysis.
Conduct data profiling, mining, and data validation to ensure data is fit for use by the business
Provide support in developing metadata, developing data quality rules, data lineage and reference data management approach
Independently Works On
Communication of work items to surface regular updates with stakeholders and regarding proposed solutions, timelines, progress, and issues
Documentation of detailed knowledge of Data Flows and processes.
Drive alignment on data decisions and enterprise definitions across different business units and stakeholders
Manage and work closely with various stakeholders (business owners, IT, department leadership, etc.) to drive through data management activities (support core data capabilities, training stakeholders, enhancing DM policy & procedure docs, etc.)
Liaise with stakeholders involved in data lineage work effort to manage ‚Äòstitching‚Äô activities to build end-to-end data lineage scenarios
Design and develop training programs to educate data producers and consumers on new data management processes across the data lifecycle
Help support the data council, including, socializing proposed solutions, and communicating decisions
Skills and Knowledge Required to fulfill the role:
Proficiency in English language, both written and verbally
Strong understanding of relational and multidimensional data design and development techniques including star schema, cube design, ETL.
Proficiency in SQL and Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) to maintain, develop, and improve data systems.

Competitive salary

Technical Security Engineer
IT Security Engineer 
This position will work directly with Security Architecture the implementation of varying greenfield initiatives and BAU Operational tuning. The individual is responsible for ISRS inter-region BAU activities and mission specific assignments as needed. The Engineer would possess a strong level of IT disciplines with a key focus around MS Defender/Identity/Azure platforms, Vulnerability Management and/or defensive security. 
Key Responsibilities: 
Manage day to day Business as usual security initiatives, ensuring deadlines, timelines, and set processes are managed and supported for AMER operations.
Work with Technical Security Architecture to ensure operational alignment with developing security roadmaps.
Collaborate with project teams to represent C&W information security policies and standards.
Work with and manage security service desk L4 concerns. Initiate and shepherd swift remediation action to resolve issues. Document and provide Knowledge Based Articles (KBA) details to service desk to resolve known issues.
Capture information risk metrics into a central repository, analyze the metrics and ensure they are meaningful and tell the true story of the GISO operations
Determine, measure, and agree on actions to ensure that the C&W GISO is looked up as a world leader and innovative in its methods
Lead or participate in various security awareness activities and other initiatives as needed.
Knowledge and Experience: 
Degree in computer science, information systems, engineering, or related field
4-7 years‚Äô experience in an IT function with administrative skills.
Excellent task management and time management skills. 
Excellent leadership and communication skills (verbal and written). 
Ability to collaborate with business and IT partners in task management and project coordination.
Large multi-national company experience preferred
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work cross-functionally and across divisions with others. 
Knowledge of, and in depth experience with, more than one major IT discipline (e.g., distributed computing, networks, Helpdesk, IT Security or IT Webs Based Training). 
Ability to manage and analyze data. 
Previous experience with endpoint EDR platforms and 3rd party perimeter monitoring tools.
Strong problem solving and program execution skills. 
Team player with creative problem-solving capabilities.
Competent in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint and SharePoint

Senior Middleware/Integration Engineer
Your new company
E-commerce start-up on a quest to develop a market leading e-commerce platform from ground zero.
Your new role
o Defining integration strategies and methods and then planning them in accordance with established deadlines and time schedules
o Creating and providing technical documentation that explains upcoming or existing integrations to non-technical individuals
o Handling a broad range of software and other programming tasks to ensure that their systems integrations are functional.
o Setup the Azure Data Platform for the Enterprise
o Setup the Middleware domain for the Enterprise (initially Istio Service Mesh / Azure Service Bus and Apache Kafka / Azure Event Hub)
o Develop Data Integration / Transmission / Replication Scenarios
o Develop Data Capture / Processing / Transformation / Import Scenarios
o Develop Service Provisinoing / Invocation / Orchestration Scenarios
o Develop Event Publication / Subscription / Processing Scenarios
o Support the Capability Maturity Model development and roadmap execution of the Middleware Domain
o Support the Capability Maturity Model development and roadmap execution of the Data Domain
What you'll need to succeed
o Experience as a Middleware / Integration Engineer for at least 3-5 years
o Architecture Experience in Event Driven Architectures, Service Oriented / Microservices Architectures, Integration Patterns, UML 2.0, B2B Integration
o Knowledge of REST/JSON, jQuery/JSON, SOAP/WSDL, XML/XSLT/Xpath
o Experience with Middleware, Integration, Complex Event Processing Technologies
o Expert in technical concepts such as connection pooling, caching, transaction management, and threading
o Significant, technical competence in integration and testing of complex software based systems; be prepared to describe examples where significant technical competence
has been demonstrated
o Experience with Data Modeling,
What you'll get in return
o Competitive salary
o Annual bonus
o Flexible home office policy

Network & Security Engineer
Responsibilities
Manages the design, implementation and ongoing management, including LAN, WAN, and Wireless Environments. 
Coordinates with networking vendors to ensure appropriate platform integration and performance. 
Makes recommendations to senior management on new technologies and products for enhancement of the network;
Leads and participates in the installation of Network systems and equipment for new facilities and expansions. 
Tests, debugs and analyses performance, and documents infrastructure components;
Develops Network infrastructure installation procedures to ensure successful integration of systems hardware/software. 
Develops and recommends technical strategies and solutions to maintain and/or expand service levels with end to end security in mind;
Monitors and analyzes network, and provides results on a regular basis. 
Takes corrective action to improve data network;
Responds to emergency situations and can perform effective troubleshooting during production outages;
Proactively test & upgrade software on various devices;
Analyze capacity management reports & propose improvements;
Our partner is - a global ICT services business - looking for a Network & Security Engineer for their team in Budapest. Their team is responsible for the management of the network & security devices in Datacenters, Connectivity towards customers and cloud providers, and on-premises network & security implementations at Customers.
Expectations
5+ years of experience in Cisco ACI/ISE/PRIME, Meraki Wireless/Firewall/SDWAN, etc IT Enterprise Products;
Checkpoint, Fortinet (Firewall), Palo Alto Firewall;
F5 (GTM, APM);
HPE Aruba (switching / wireless);
English speaking & writing skills (additional languages are considered a plus);
Any two certifications are considered a plus:
Checkpoint CCSE / CCSM;
Cisco CCNP R&S / Sec / Wireless;
Fortinet NSE 4 or Higher;
F5 Certified Solution Expert;
Meraki Certified Meraki Network Operator;
Offer
Competitive salary;
Cafeteria;
Health insurance;
Training and courses;
Sport opportunity;

Senior IT Asset Management Analyst
Managing a detailed inventory of our organization's software and hardware assets;
Applying the information to assist with determining the best decisions concerning IT-related purchases and redistribution of assets throughout the organization is also your task;
Provide support for the governance concerning the ITAM tools applied in managing, monitoring, and reporting on IT assets and inventory;
Work with the ITSM manager to establish a relationship and consistency between the IT Asset database and the CMDB;
Perform verification and audit of DML and CMDB content; verify software assets with license contracts, confirm hardware assets with actual inventory, and initiate corrective actions and track them;
Managing and maintaining databases and records of information such as licenses, service agreements, and warranties for the organization‚Äôs software and hardware;
Help to establish and manage the team KPI/Metrics and run standardized reporting on a scheduled basis together with unscheduled reporting demanded by management;
Take part in various projects, providing support to Managers and up to VPs of Infrastructure and Finance;
Establish and maintain documentation of procedures, processes, and reports concerning asset and configuration management;
Aegon Global Technology Services (GTS) provides IT infrastructure and application support services to the Aegon businesses.¬†GTS is responsible for the provision, support, and ongoing maintenance of IT operating platforms, applications, and services. There is also a strong connection with external providers necessitating vendor and service provider management. GTS is responsible for driving the technology strategy and providing IT infrastructure solutions aligned with business objectives and the¬†GTS¬†technology strategy.
Manage against the ITAM service delivery model to include a global purview of all IT hardware and Software to include SaaS. Responsible for managing a detailed inventory of the organization‚Äôs software and hardware assets. Management of applying operational and vendor information to assist with determining the best decisions concerning IT-related purchases and redistribution of assets throughout the organization.¬† Creation of Licensing positions.¬† Assist with and have responsibility for modelling key, global and regional licenses against opportunity for optimization and cost savings, and compliance with software agreements.¬† The intent for this role is to feed into the strategy in how the organization allocates and purchases globally to eliminate waste and increase efficiency in how IT Assets are utilized.¬† This role will help to implement policies, systems, processes, and standards related to how we manage IT Assets, on a daily and long-term basis.¬† This role will also identify, map, and report against the alignment of each IT Asset and the contract under which each is governed.¬† This role ensures quality control throughout the lifecycle of each IT Asset.¬†
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business, technology, or related field or demonstratable experience;
Minimum three years of experience and knowledge with IT hardware and or software asset management;¬†
Experience with interpretation of software licensing contract terms and conditions;
Significant knowledge and five years plus experience working with a CMDB and the specific business services that it supports;
Understanding of complex software agreements;
Knowledge of licensing agreements involving software, including Microsoft, IBM, and Oracle;
Well-versed vendor management and negotiation skills;

Data Analyst Expert
Our partner is one of the world's biggest financial providers, which has a regional IT and financial center located in Budapest. They are looking for a new colleague, who would like to gain knowledge in a cutting-edge data analytics, reporting and integration platform called KNIME. The new member of the team will actively take part in the finance regulatory reporting workflows by transforming data and automating processes using complex data structures. Stable and truly multicultural corporate environment, work-life balance, further career opportunities, competitive salary and attractive benefit package are waiting for the new colleague.
About this position
Take part in keeping close contact and maintaining effective communication with technology teams and with stakeholders in the Financial Regulatory
Reporting departments and other business units
Gather and understand business needs regarding the regulatory reporting processes and workflows, and identify possible technical solutions
Analyze, transform and automate complex and diverse data structures, create workflows using KNIME and establish user testing for the optimal usage
Participate in setting strategic direction for automation of reports, integrating the special area know-how with an in-depth understanding of industry standards and best-practices in data transformation
Mentor and train junior team members, support non-technical colleagues, facilitate handover of the final solution
Requirements
Min. 3-4 years of experience in reporting roles, where automation and transformation functions were also necessary
A background in finance and/or computer science
Relevant higher-education degree
Experience in the field of banking is beneficial
Advanced MS Excel knowledge
Experience with any of the following data transformation, automation, visualization tools: KNIME, Alteryx, Talend, Tableau, PowerBI, VBA, Qlik, Python etc.
Fluent English both verbally and in writing
High level of analytical skills, structured mindset, ability to work with complex and diverse data structures
Precision, need for clean codes and scripts
Good interpersonal skills, ability to manage stakeholder and partner relationships across large, matrixed organizations
Ability to work independently, actively put forward ideas and solutions to help the organization operate more efficiently
High degree of curiosity, also be able to follow industry specific guidelines and SOPs
Offer
A visible impact on data transformation and automation projects on a higher level as well
Work-life balance, no overtime
Attractive benefits (health insurance/all you can move/ private pension/ community events)
Multicultural atmosphere
Home office opportunity
Flexible working hours

Technology Risk Consulting
Senior Consultant ‚Äì Technology Risk
Your new company¬†
¬†Our partner, who a professional services firm, providing Assurance, Consulting, Strategy and Transactions, Tax services, is looking for a Senior Consultant in Technology Risk sector.¬†
Your new position¬†
¬†As a Senior Consultant, you will support IT audits, IT support of financial audits, IT risk assessments, IT control assessments, ERP process reviews, technical security risk assessments, and consulting engagements with the support of the IT Audit Manager. We are looking for professionals having IT audit, IT and business process experience, and great communication skills.
Your key responsibilities will be:
Participate in enterprise risk management implementations.
Support clients in strategy and execution for the compliance program to include SOC2, SOX, GDPR, and other regulatory data handling certifications.
Recognising new business opportunities that create value for clients and turning them into projects.
Planning and responsible for delivering IT Audits successfully, ensuring profitability of projects, and handling the administrative tasks as a manager.
Coaching and responsible for the development of junior colleagues, acting as a team leader with the support of partners.
What you need for the success¬†
¬†To fill this position you need university degree in a relevant field, e.g. Computer Science and/or Economics, Software Engineering, 3+ years‚Äô experience in IT audit, leading IT audits and smaller teams, broad understanding of industry standards and frameworks (ISO 27001-2 and/or COBIT and/or ITIL), experience in ERP systems, processes, and application controls experience using SQL language, solid writing and communication skills, fluent in English and Hungarian.

Front End engineer 
Your new company
When you join to our Partner you join a multicultural and diverse community working across more than 600 schools and offices in 50 countries, all with one shared mission of opening the world through education. Whoever you are, whatever you are passionate about‚Äîthey welcome you and want you to bring that to work every day. Our Partner is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and they are committed to inclusion and belonging across race, ethnicity, gender, age, religion, caste, parental status, identity, experience and everything else that makes you unique.
Your new role
As a Senior Software Engineer, you will be responsible for delivering end-to-end features for our Partner's Sales Consultants through developing their applications and APIs.Together with Lead Software Engineers and Engineering Managers, you will be developing first-class software solutions, both on the front-end side using React and TypeScript, as well as on the back-end side, evolving our Partner's ecosystem based on a serverless architecture.¬†
What you'll need to succeed:¬†
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related Engineering discipline (or equivalent).
4+ years of hands-on JavaScript/TypeScript development experience.
Robust design and development skills in React.
Very good design pattern knowledge and enterprise integration paradigms.
Test-driven mindset.
Experience teaching and mentoring other engineers in new technologies.
Knowledge of software best practices like refactoring, Clean Code, Domain Driven Design, and SOLID principles.
For this role it would be nice if you have:
Experience working with CSS or SCSS.
Experience working with web services and REST API development.
Experience working with AWS.
Experience working with Electron.
Experience working with MobX.
Experience working with GitHub and GitHub Actions.
AWS developer and/or architect certifications Mindset and interpersonal skills.
You have good communication skills in English ‚Äì not just spoken but also written.

You have strong attention to detail and excellent problem-solving skills

Network Engineer
Tasks
Supporting our client's automation control system development and closely collaborating with the sales & bid manager
Configuration of switches/routers/firewalls under consideration of IT security requirements, commissioning of these as well as ensuring error-free functioning of the network during unit and system tests‚ÄØ¬†
Preparation of technical specifications and documentation regarding communication and IT security in the projects¬†
Our partner is a well known technology company, with almost 2,000 employees worldwide, our client's Controls and Digitalization teams has a global presence. Their team focuses on providing value-added services and solutions to our customers in the areas of control, digitization, automation and electrical equipment.¬†
Expectations
Several years of professional experience of network OR IT security
Very good knowledge of LAN/WAN, TCP/IP, switching, routing, VPN and RF technologies as well as IT-Security concepts, standards, and hardening measures¬†
Knowledge in configuration of the hardware components related to switching/routing/firewall (Cisco, Ruggedcom, Checkpoint, Scalance switches and firewalls, etc.)¬†

Project Security & Privacy Manager
Your new company
In our Budapest Application Development Center of our Global Partner, we create next generation automotive software solutions which make automated driving safe and affordable.
Be part of the growth as a Project Security & Privacy Manager!
We work towards Vision Zero, a goal to eliminate fatal accidents happening every day on the world‚Äôs roads. We are looking for creative minds who are passionate to shape the future of automated driving by delivering software solutions for ADAS customer projects.
As Project Security & Privacy Manager you will plan and organize the security-related aspects and their work products for a specific component project. You will act as an interface to the project team and customer for all security or privacy aspects regarding the full chain of effect of dedicated system level. You will define the security and privacy work products, track their status, and prepare reports about the maturity and proactively communicate risks to the project manager.
Your new role
align of develop interface agreement for S&P with customer and suppliers
provision the Project S&P Plan and Schedule
initiate and plann SEC assessment
plan and trace work products and their reviews which are part of Security Case
track the implementation status and performance of the S&P Risk Assessment for each delivery release.
create and adaptation of system architecture with S&P aspects
perform Security & Privacy Analysis and Risk Assessments (VARA, PIA)
What you'll need to succeed
university degree (BSc, MSc, PhD) in a technical area: Computer Science, Electronics, Electrical Engineering or related.
profound knowledge of Security (IT security, SW, HW, System)
good overview of Data Protection (privacy regulation), Security & Privacy standard, methods, and approaches (ISO/SAE 21434)
experience in the automotive development processes
good understanding of system architecture and requirements engineering
knowledge in technical risk analyses (e.g.: TARA, STRIDE, FMEA)
good command of the English language
What you'll get in return
Participation in exciting, highly innovative projects
Ability to directly deliver software into real products
Access to cutting-edge technologies and to one of Europe‚Äôs largest in-house GPU clusters
A friendly, respectful and collaborative work environment that encourages creativity and innovation
Continuous development with access to numerous trainings, including technical skills, soft skills and language skills
Personal career development and a challenging role with end-to-end responsibility
Opportunity to see your ideas turn into reality with our test vehicles
Competitive compensation and a wide range of benefits, including:
Bonus system
Annual flexible benefit (Cafeteria)
Private health insurance
Employee discounts
Sport pass support
Ability to directly deliver software into real, innovative products
Flexible work-from-home arrangements
Easily accessible office location in downtown Budapest (near K√°lvin square)
What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

Are you looking for a chance to work in truly European spirit with their future technological developments?Together you fly 110 aircraft to 145 destinations, bringing millions of passengers to where they need to be, developing sustainable travel and pushing the boundaries of air travel towards to the future.
Software Engineering Lead
Feladatok
Very briefly, you will be working on some of their core systems that support our Client's flying crew members. From systems that enable planning and rostering of their crew to ensuring the right catering is placed onboard every flight, the 3 domains within Flight have a very diverse application landscape. Through your work, you will have a direct impact on their crew, their aircrafts, and their customers.
They offer a very open environment for you to grow and expand your talents, together you will contribute to their goal of becoming the number one data- and technology-driven airline.
In addition:You will supervise a number of software engineers;You will be the link between your department and the rest of the business;You will be part of the tech management and you will give direction to technical solutions;You will work with different programming tools

Robotics Process Automation Lead Analyst
Tasks
Manages technical components of moderately complex IT projects.
Coordinates activities of the project team, identifies necessary resources and develops schedules to meet completion deadlines.
Verifies team adherence to control and risk implementations as well as standards and process changes.
Applies good understanding of concepts and procedures within own IT project leadership area to resolve issues.
Directly impacts the IT project leadership area through shared responsibility for delivery of end results and contribution to planning, budget management and formulation of procedures; influences resource planning.
Persuades and influences others through communication and diplomacy skills; may negotiate with external parties.
Acts as SME to senior stakeholders and /or other team members.
Our Client is one of the leading investment banks in the world, and for their growing professional team we are looking for a RPA Lead Analyst.
Expectations
Bachelor‚Äôs/University degree or equivalent experience
3+ years technology with actual experience in managing application development, infrastructure platforms, architecture/network design, database management. Actual Robotic Process Automation experience a must
Practical expertise in emerging technologies (i.e., Cloud, APIs, social media) required.¬†Banking or Financial industry background a plus
Must be able to demonstrate knowledge of standard Control or Risk Management Frameworks related to disaster recovery, and vendor, change and capacity management
Experience managing global or cross-business projects in a matrix organizational structure is required
Audit/Control or Technical Consulting experience a plus
Offer
This role will provide opportunities to deepen the knowledge of the special characteristics of a global team within a multinational company.
Opportunity to develop the individual‚Äôs project management skills, to plan and get prepared for the upcoming milestones which effect the team‚Äôs daily operation.
Private Medical Care Program and onsite medical rooms in our buildings
Pension Plan Contribution to Voluntary Pension Fund

Java Software Engineer (in Platform Engineering) (Budapest)

Java Software Engineer (in Platform Engineering)
You‚Äôll be part of our efficient, technology obsessed, and collaborative Platform Engineering team where you will be designing, building and maintaining solutions that extend our AWS cloud-based platform with new features. As part of the role, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to dive deep into all parts of our platform and participate in our journey to build a strong foundation for all of services and technology solutions.
We‚Äôre now looking for an enthusiastic and experienced individual to join their team in Budapest, Hungary. You‚Äôll be part of a distributed remote team with a strong culture of openness, transparency, and kindness. You‚Äôll have the opportunity to closely work with and learn from experienced senior team members on a daily basis. They‚Äôre a cross-functional team that combines areas of backend Software Engineering and infrastructure Ops/DevOps.
Key activities
Research, design, build, improve, and automate the next iteration of the Flexion platform
Improve the developer experience of their product development teams by providing a streamlined set of tools, standards, and processes for application development, continuous integration, development environments
Build robust, scalable, easy-to-use and easy-to-understand platform solutions used by other software developers in their daily work
Implement performance improvements and optimizations of critical parts of their services
Take a key role in migrating remaining functionalities from monolithic application setup to microservices design and deployment
Create highly scalable software solutions for serving tens of millions daily request from across the whole world
Our Client is a leader in one of the fastest and biggest sectors of entertainment - mobile games. Their goal is to improve and change the mobile games industry forever. They help game developers and distribution channels generate more revenue from games by expanding their reach and distribution.¬†
Requirements
Educated to degree level in computer science or related discipline, or relevant experience in the field
5+ years of experience in software development or Ops/DevOps
Ability to visit our office in Budapest on an ad-hoc/monthly/weekly basis
Professional working proficiency in English
Skills that drive success in this role
Unix/Linux/Bash, setting up and managing virtual servers. Managing virtual servers and related virtual cloud infrastructure is at the core of what they do.
Docker, application containerization. A docker container is their standard unit of deployment.
Clean coding skills. They are always expanding the areas where they apply the ‚Äúinfrastructure as code‚Äù approach. They write new code and they carefully review the code of their colleagues, ranging from small infrastructure automation scripts, continuous integration support, to more complex backend code.
Kubernetes, Helm. They continue migrating more of their services into their cluster environment where deployment and other usual tasks are fully automated.
SQL, MySQL. They manage and provide various data storage services to other dev teams, SQL databases are one of the main technologies in this area.
Ability to decompose problems and changes into small incremental steps. They use agile approaches to software development, and platform is no exception. They aim to deliver changes and results in small and safe incremental changes.
A critical mindset and a strong problem-solving ability. They work with complex systems using complex technologies and they rarely see the same problem twice.
Balancing autonomous work with clear communication with peers. Every team member has the opportunity to fully own and drive their own projects, but they does not work alone. Peers are always available to provide feedback and discuss possible approaches.
Additional skills useful in this role
IaaS platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure, ...)
JUnit/TestNG
GitOps, CDK, EKS, Flux
CI/CD pipelines, Jenkins
Offer
A wide range of learning opportunities. They work in many different areas, and even their most senior members never stop learning new technologies and approaches. They learn from each other and they join courses online and on-site. Their team members have various certifications acquired through and funded by the company.
Support from a number of domain experts. Members of the team are experts in many different areas, so you will always have someone to turn to for help.
A clear set of priorities, plans, and strategies. You will always know how you can best contribute to the success of the team, the company, and their customers.
A culture of transparency and kindness. They are a diverse company and they openly discuss our views and value everyone‚Äôs opinion.
Company share options
Company phone, company laptop
Visits to our London headquarters
Team events, gatherings, conferences
Private Medical Insurance
Travel reimbursement

Frontend Software Engineer
As a Front-end specialist, you will apply your skills to change the way KLM works, driving innovation and transforming us into a truly data-driven organization. We value both technical expertise (analysis, design &
architecture, engineering, quality assurance and DevSecOps) as well as the interpersonal parts of the job (coaching, consulting, coordination, and support).
As a software engineer Front-end, your key result areas are:
Make use of right technology and govern architecture for products in line with the organizational objectives, ensuring that the right technologies are chosen to strike an optimal balance between
achieving business goals, realizing functional and technical requirements, and managing technical debt,
development costs and continuity costs
Design and implement the overall architecture aligned with other optimizers for the product to deliver
Translate business needs into compelling products and deliver them to end users so that business value is created
Take care of specification, design, engineering, testing, delivery, maintenance, monitoring, and support of digital products
Foster a culture where state-of-the-art approaches, tooling and technologies are applied as fits with the mission of the department, the KPI‚Äôs and desired business impact
Are you passionate about software and about aviation? Do you love a technical challenge and like to work on multiple platforms to create a consistent experience for the consumers?
Our partner company has 30.000 employees worldwide. The company has a head office in Paris and Amsterdam and has several daughter companies. The group has over 550 aircraft and they are one of the bigger players in Europe. The developers they are hiring now will be working from Budapest, but fully part of the product teams.
The company has gone through a major restructuring over the last two years to adjust to the covid crisis. They are now implementing a strategic restructuring program in which one of the pillars is the Data & Technology track. They have expressed the ambition to become the most data and tech-driven accompany in their sector. To do this, they are innovating and expanding and thus looking to attract more experts to the company.
Preferably Bachelor degree or higher in Computer Science, Software Engineering or other relevant fields
Minimum of 5 years of professional experience with JavaScript / TypeScript, HTML, CSS and SASS
Minimum of 2 years of experience building enterprise production-grade Angular applications
Experience with consuming APIs and knowledge of REST API best practices
Knowledge of continuous integration/continuous deployment techniques and tools (Kubernetes, GitHub Actions, Bamboo)
Proficient with automated testing (e.g., Unit tests, End-2-End tests)
Experience with Bootstrap, tailwind or other CSS frameworks
Experience with bringing enterprise Front-end applications to production and supporting Front-enders in industrializing their code
Experience in coaching and knowledge sharing to familiarize teams with software engineering best practices
Knowledge with and experience in agile way of working (e.g., SAFe, Scrum, Agile)
Great communication skills, written and spoken (English) and team spirit
This role requires participation in our on-call support rotation every six weeks
All our teams have a hybrid way of working, we do ask you to come to the office every so often to meet your colleagues, to participate in trainings or team events.
In addition, the following requirements are considered nice to have:
Experience with other frontend frameworks (e.g., React, Vue.js)
Experience with Node.js, NestJS and GraphQL.
Experience with state management like NGRX or Redux
Experience with UX design
A competitive salary depending on your level and experience
10% of your time set aside for personal learning and development
An excellent pension scheme, profit sharing, and yearly bonus.
Substantial discounts on flight tickets (after 6 months of employment)
A travel allowance
Discount on health insurance
A learning budget

Data Scientist
Your new company
Market leading automotive company is looking for aspiring Data Scientist to work on international projects, on the field of advanced analytics and machine learning models.
Your new role
‚ñ∫ Analyse big datasets acquired during the development and production of automotive sensors, choose the proper machine learning algorithm to produce smart solutions and to improve decision making considering customer specifications, reliability theory, automotive standards and legal regulations
‚ñ∫ Design and optimize both data acquisition process and data analytics workflows
‚ñ∫ Initiate open discussions, provide clear communication and answers with your data, deliver results according to project timelines and quality expectations, and create reports in English
‚ñ∫ Continuous improvement of analytic workflows regarding performance based on user feedback
‚ñ∫ Collaborate and share methodologies actively with your internal and external partners in manufacturing, and sensor development (e.g. validation and reliability engineers, data engineers/analysts). Cooperate in an international team.
‚ñ∫ Perform root cause analysis and support corrective measure implementation using 8D, problem solving methods and LL
What you'll need to succeed
‚ñ∫ BSc or MSc in computer science, mechatronics, electrical engineering, physics or comparable
‚ñ∫ Strong programming skills in Python (pandas, numpy, scikit-learn, tensorflow, keras) and SQL
‚ñ∫ Strong background and experience in data mining workflow and development of machine learning algorithms
‚ñ∫ Good communication and presentation skills
‚ñ∫ Excellent statistical, analytical and problem solving skills
‚ñ∫ Version control knowledge (git)
‚ñ∫ Precise working style, good planning, time management and organizational skills, active tracking of tasks
‚ñ∫ Ability to work individually and in international teams, sharing ideas
‚ñ∫ Be self-initiative, open, innovative and have a growth mindset
‚ñ∫ Very good command of English
What you'll get in return
‚ñ∫ Competitive salary
‚ñ∫ Cafeteria
‚ñ∫ Annual bonus
‚ñ∫ Felxible home office
What you need to do now

Our Client is one of the leading investment banks in the world, and for their growing professional team we are looking for an Senior Automation Developer.
Senior Automation Developer
Feladatok
Developing and encouraging the adoption of standard approaches that:
improve testing processes (unit testing, code review process)
improve current quality control processes
help create automation workflows in a resource effective way
Identify recurring error sources to decrease the number of issues emerging after handover to Business users
Assure the continuity of business for stakeholders that utilize the automation solutions developed by the entire digital team by:
Handling incidents, urgent change requests and urgent fixes in connection with workflows that are in production
Assuring that maintenance development artefacts adhere to internal standards and policies
Monitoring and assessing the risk of outdated standard components applied in workflows that are in production
Identifying, recommending and implementing process improvements to enhance testing strategies
Creating proposals for workflow retrofit with the involvement of technology and reporting teams
Driving the retrofitting process of workflows that contain outdated standard components.
Developing automated solutions in KNIME data transformation and automation tool
Incidents may need to be addressed on bank holidays and after-hours occasionally, very rarely on weekends.
K√∂vetelm√©nyek

Excellent command of the English language (both written and spoken)
Experience in financial sector is an advantage
Familiarity with software testing methodologies is an advantage

Skills
Excellent analytical skills

Our partner is an IT security company based in Switzerland. MOBILE APPLICATION TESTER

Our Client is a leader in one of the fastest and biggest sectors of entertainment - mobile games. Their goal is to improve and change the mobile games industry forever. They help game developers and distribution channels generate more revenue from games by expanding their reach and distribution.¬†
Java Software Engineer (in Platform Engineering)
Feladatok
You‚Äôll be part of our efficient, technology obsessed, and collaborative Platform Engineering team where you will be designing, building and maintaining solutions that extend our AWS cloud-based platform with new features. As part of the role, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to dive deep into all parts of our platform and participate in our journey to build a strong foundation for all of services and technology solutions.
We‚Äôre now looking for an enthusiastic and experienced individual to join their team in Budapest, Hungary. You‚Äôll be part of a distributed remote team with a strong culture of openness, transparency, and kindness. You‚Äôll have the opportunity to closely work with and learn from experienced senior team members on a daily basis. They‚Äôre a cross-functional team that combines areas of backend Software Engineering and infrastructure Ops/DevOps.
Key activities
Research, design, build, improve, and automate the next iteration of the Flexion platform
Improve the developer experience of their product development teams by providing a streamlined set of tools, standards, and processes for application development, continuous integration, development environments
Build robust, scalable, easy-to-use and easy-to-understand platform solutions used by other software developers in their daily work
Implement performance improvements and optimizations of critical parts of their services
Take a key role in migrating remaining functionalities from monolithic application setup to microservices design and deployment
Create highly scalable software solutions for serving tens of millions daily request from across the whole world
K√∂vetelm√©nyek
Skills that drive success in this role
Java, clean coding skills.¬†Some of our most impactful changes are done on the software backend side of the services that we run and we use Java even for the automation of our platform itself.
Spring Boot.¬†We provide standardised service setup to other dev teams and this industry standard framework is an integral part of it.
Unix/Linux/Bash. Managing virtual servers and related virtual cloud infrastructure is at the core of what they do.
Docker, application containerization.¬†A docker container is our standard unit of deployment.
SQL, MySQL. They manage and provide various data storage services to other dev teams, SQL databases are one of the main technologies in this area.
Kubernetes, Helm. They continue migrating more of their services into our cluster environment where deployment and other usual tasks are fully automated.
Ability to decompose problems and changes into small incremental steps. They use agile approaches to software development, and platform is no exception. They aim to deliver changes and results in small and safe incremental changes.
A critical mindset and a strong problem-solving ability. We work with complex systems using complex technologies and they rarely see the same problem twice.
Balancing autonomous work with clear communication with peers. Every team member has the opportunity to fully own and drive their own projects, but they don‚Äôt work alone. Peers are always available to provide feedback and discuss possible approaches.
Additional skills useful in this role
JUnit/TestNG
CI/CD pipelines, Jenkins, Git
GitOps (Flux)
IaaS platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure, ...)
Further requirements
Educated to degree level in computer science or related discipline, or relevant experience in the field
5+ years of experience in software development or Ops/DevOps
Ability to visit our office in Budapest on an ad-hoc/monthly/weekly basis
Professional working proficiency in English

A wide range of learning opportunities. They work in many different areas, and even their most senior members never stop learning new technologies and approaches. They learn from each other and they join courses online and on-site. Their team members have various certifications acquired through and funded by the company.
Support from a number of domain experts. Members of the team are experts in many different areas, so you will always have someone to turn to for help.
A clear set of priorities, plans, and strategies. You will always know how you can best contribute to the success of the team, the company, and their customers.
